min(cvt.name) assaytype --min( assaytype ) assaytype --, chiptype_dbxref_id, assaytype_dbxref_id from cur_exp_condition t40, cvterm cvt where t40.curxpa_id = m1.curxpa_id and cvt.dbxref_id = t40.assaytype_dbxref_id ) , (select min(cvt.name) chiptype --min( chiptype ) chiptype --coalesce(chiptype,' ') chiptype --, chiptype_dbxref_id, assaytype_dbxref_id from cur_exp_condition t40, cvterm cvt where t40.curxpa_id = m1.curxpa_id and cvt.dbxref_id = t40.chiptype_dbxref_id ) , (select min( tissue_eqe_name ) tissue_eqe_name --coalesce(chiptype,' ') chiptype --, chiptype_dbxref_id, assaytype_dbxref_id from cur_exp_condition t40 where t40.curxpa_id = m1.curxpa_id ) , (select min(cvt.short_name) tissue_name --min( tissue_name ) tissue_name --coalesce(chiptype,' ') chiptype --, chiptype_dbxref_id, assaytype_dbxref_id from cur_exp_condition t40, anatomy_item cvt where t40.curxpa_id = m1.curxpa_id and cvt.dbxref_id = t40.tissue_dbxref_id ) , (select min(cvt.short_name) start_stg_name --min( start_stg_name ) start_stg_name --coalesce(chiptype,' ') chiptype --, chiptype_dbxref_id, assaytype_dbxref_id from cur_exp_condition t40, stage cvt where t40.curxpa_id = m1.curxpa_id and cvt.dbxref_id = t40.start_stg_dbxref_id ) -- , ( select m2.lowest_gsm_id exp_init_gsm_id from exp_list m2 where m1.co_prop_id = m2.exp_co_prop_id ) , ( select m2.lowest_gsm_id ctrl_init_gsm_id from exp_list m2 where m1.ctrl_co_prop_id = m2.exp_co_prop_id ) -- , ( select m2.exp_gsm_list exp_gsm_list from exp_list m2 where m1.co_prop_id = m2.exp_co_prop_id ) , ( select m2.exp_gsm_list ctrl_gsm_list from exp_list m2 where m1.ctrl_co_prop_id = m2.exp_co_prop_id ) -- SRR , ( select min(m2.exp_srr_list) exp_srr_list from srr_list m2 where m1.co_prop_id = m2.exp_co_prop_id ) , ( select min(m2.exp_srr_list) ctrl_srr_list from srr_list m2 where m1.ctrl_co_prop_id = m2.exp_co_prop_id ) -- , ( select m2.lowest_srr_id exp_init_srr_id from srr_list m2 where m1.co_prop_id = m2.exp_co_prop_id ) , ( select m2.lowest_srr_id ctrl_init_srr_id from srr_list m2 where m1.ctrl_co_prop_id = m2.exp_co_prop_id ) -- lib layout , ( select min(m2.librarylayout) librarylayout from srr_list m2 where m1.co_prop_id = m2.exp_co_prop_id ) -- lib strategy , ( select min(m2.assaytype) srr_assaytype from srr_list m2 where m1.co_prop_id = m2.exp_co_prop_id ) --assaytype --, ( select min(m2.assaytype) assaytype from srr_list m2 where m1.ctrl_co_prop_id = m2.exp_co_prop_id ) --srp , ( select min(m2.srp) srp from srr_list m2 where m1.co_prop_id = m2.exp_co_prop_id ) , ( select min(m2.sra_reccount) sra_reccount from srr_list m2 where m1.co_prop_id = m2.exp_co_prop_id ) from m1 --order by 1,2 --m1.co_prop_id

table.name: CUR_EXP_GEO_XML
table.remarks: geo xml data and references

table.name: CUR_EXP_GSE_STATUS_CURRENT_V
table.viewSql: create or replace view cur_exp_gse_status_current_v as select t3.gses_id, t3.gse_id, t1.cur_record_id, t4.curxpsts_id , t5.* from cur_record t1, cur_obj t2, cur_exp_gses t3, cur_exp_status t4, cur_status t5 where t2.cur_obj_name = 'GEO data' and t2.cur_obj_id = t1.cur_obj_id and t3.gses_id = t1.row_id and t4.cur_record_id = t1.cur_record_id and t5.cur_status_id = t4.curxp_status

table.name: CUR_EXP_GSE_STATUS_LIST_V
table.viewSql: create or replace view cur_exp_gse_status_list_v as with m1 as (select t3.gses_id, t3.gse_id, t1.cur_record_id ,LISTAGG(t5.cur_status_id,'|') WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY t5.cur_status_id) cur_status_ids ,LISTAGG(t5.name,'|') WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY t5.cur_status_id) cur_names --, t5.* from cur_record t1, cur_obj t2, cur_exp_gses t3, cur_exp_status t4, cur_status t5 where t2.cur_obj_name = 'GEO data' and t2.cur_obj_id = t1.cur_obj_id and t3.gses_id = t1.row_id and t4.cur_record_id = t1.cur_record_id and t5.cur_status_id = t4.curxp_status --and t3.gse_id not in ( 2266 ) group by t3.gses_id, t3.gse_id, t1.cur_record_id ) select t6.gse_id --, m1.* , m1.cur_status_ids , m1.cur_names from cur_exp_gses t6 , m1 where m1.gse_id (+) = t6.gse_id --order by t6.gse_id

table.name: CUR_EXP_GSE_STATUS_V
table.viewSql: create or replace view cur_exp_gse_status_v as select t3.gses_id, t3.gse_id, t1.cur_record_id, t4.curxpsts_id, t5.* --, t4.* from cur_record t1, cur_obj t2, cur_exp_gses t3, cur_exp_status t4, cur_status t5 where t2.cur_obj_name = 'GEO data' and t2.cur_obj_id = t1.cur_obj_id and t3.gses_id = t1.row_id and t4.cur_record_id = t1.cur_record_id and t5.cur_status_id = t4.curxp_status

table.name: CUR_EXP_GSES
table.remarks: GEO attribution data for experiment group

table.name: CUR_EXP_GSMS
table.remarks: GEO attribution data for experiment series

column.name: CO_PROP_ID
column.remarks: association of EM and Assay to replicate

table.name: CUR_EXP_GSMS_CTRL
table.remarks: GSM that has one or more control given by gsms_control_id

column.name: CO_PROP_ID
column.remarks: group identifier

column.name: CONTROL_CO_PROP_ID
column.remarks: Control group identifier

table.name: CUR_EXP_IMAGE_V
table.viewSql: CREATE or REPLACE view cur_exp_image_v as select distinct t4.image_id , t4.image_panel_ref, t4.image_panel_id, t3.co_prop_id , t3.curxprel_id , t3.pheno_id ,t5.paper_id -- , t1.* from cur_exp_statement t1 , cur_exp_stm_pheno t10 , cur_exp_co_prop t2 , cur_exp_pheno t3 , cur_exp_image_panel t4 , cur_exp_method t5 where 1=1 and t1.curxps_id = t10.curxps_id and t10.pheno_id = t3.pheno_id and t2.co_prop_id = t3.co_prop_id and t3.pheno_id = t4.pheno_id (+) and t5.curxprel_id = t2.curxprel_id

table.name: CUR_EXP_INVENTORY_LOG
table.remarks: Data Loader Job Control Log History

table.name: CUR_EXP_METHOD
table.remarks: identify members of article or other logical group

table.name: CUR_EXP_NOTE
table.remarks: current status soft-linked to a table record

table.name: CUR_EXP_PHENO_STATUS_CURRENT_V
table.viewSql: create or replace view cur_exp_pheno_status_current_v as select t3.pheno_id, t1.cur_record_id, t4.curxpsts_id , t5.* from cur_record t1, cur_obj t2, cur_exp_pheno t3, cur_exp_status t4, cur_status t5 where t2.tabname = 'CUR_EXP_PHENO' and t2.cur_obj_id = t1.cur_obj_id and t3.pheno_id = t1.row_id and t4.cur_record_id = t1.cur_record_id and t5.cur_status_id = t4.curxp_status

table.name: CUR_EXP_PROCESS_CTRL
table.remarks: geo loader process conrol tracking xml miniml data and references

table.name: CUR_EXP_SPECIES_VERSION
table.remarks: GEO system config for species vesion

column.name: DBXREF_ID
column.remarks: dbxref for the species version

column.name: EFFECTIVE_START_DT
column.remarks: version end effective date

column.name: CURRENT_FLAG
column.remarks: set to 1 for the current species version

column.name: EXT_SPECIES_VERSION
column.remarks: standard folder name

column.name: PREFIX_SPECIES_VERSION
column.remarks: standard gene prefix

table.name: CUR_EXP_SRA_RUNTBL
table.remarks: SRA RUN TABLE data

table.name: CUR_EXP_STATEMENT
table.remarks: composition either pre- as in XPO or post- as in EQE for GO and Expression as Phenotype.

table.name: CUR_EXP_STATUS
table.remarks: current status soft-linked to a table record

table.name: CUR_EXP_STM_DECOMPOSE
table.remarks: holds reference to CURXPtype_statement (ie:phenstatement). individual components of EQE segregated with dbxref_id. supports post composition to multiple levels. differentiates between entity and related_entity in composition of CURXPtype statement.

column.name: CURXPS_ID
column.remarks: ref to statement FK

column.name: CURXPSD_RANK
column.remarks: ordering of terms to support post composition

column.name: CURXPSD_RELATED
column.remarks: identify as related entity composition when 1 else 0

column.name: ENTITY_1_SUBTERM_ACC
column.remarks: accession stored with prefix ie GO: PATO:

column.name: ENTITY_1_SUBTERM_ID
column.remarks: store the dbxref_id for accession

table.name: CUR_EXP_TX
table.remarks: Experimental Manipulation factors. ie Treatment Tx

column.name: CURXPX_ID
column.remarks: ref to CURXPtype_experiment FK

column.name: RANK
column.remarks: ordering of EM data rank 1 through 5

column.name: APPLY_TYPE_NAME
column.remarks: ManipulationTypeName such as mRNA inj; heat shock; chemical

column.name: START_STG_DBXREF_ID
column.remarks: dbxref_id for StageusedID

column.name: END_STG_DBXREF_ID
column.remarks: dbxref_id for StageusedendID

column.name: FEATURE_ID
column.remarks: ref to feature FK

column.name: FEATURE_NAME
column.remarks: Reagent such as MORPH; TRANSGENE; CHEMICAL; GENE

column.name: UNCATFEATURE_ID
column.remarks: ref to feature FK

column.name: RRID_CID
column.remarks: describe what this column is for

column.name: APPLY_RX_LOC_ACC
column.remarks: TreatmentareaID aka treatment location

table.name: CUR_EXP_TX_TARGET
table.remarks: Experimental Manipulation properties to handle multiple references such as target feature_id

column.name: CURXPXMT_ID
column.remarks: PK for table

column.name: TARGET_FEATURE_ID
column.remarks: gene feature

column.name: TARGET_FEATURE_TYPE
column.remarks: gene feature type typically 1214

table.name: CUR_NOTE
table.remarks: individual notes made by curators on the curation of a record

table.name: CUR_OBJ
table.remarks: A odata bject in the database that may be a target for curation. Each object corresponds to a table but a table may have multiple curatable objects

table.name: CUR_OBJ_ALLOWABLE_CONTENT
table.remarks: restricts what content can be associated with a particular curation object. Note that a category will include its sub-contents

table.name: CUR_OBJ_REL
table.remarks: describes encapsulating relationships betweendifferent curation objects e.g. article and article content

table.name: CUR_REC_REL
table.remarks: describes encapsulating relationships between different curation records e.g. article and images

table.name: CUR_RECORD
table.remarks: is the central curation metadata record surrounding a particular contant instance, which corresponds to the curation of a specific record in the databse

column.name: RELEVANT
column.remarks: field is used when a record is created to indicate taht an article ins not relevant

table.name: CUR_RECORD_CONTENT
table.remarks: Describes that content of a curatoable record. Also, may be used to indicate a curatable record does not contain a particular type of content. This is particularily useful if an automated content generation is used to indicate the content of a table.

column.name: CONTAINS_CONTENT
column.remarks: Indicates whether the record contains content or not 1 indicates taht it should contain content while 0 indicates that it does not contain content. 0 should only be set when a curator is indicating a record does not contain any conten

table.name: CUR_STATUS
table.remarks: contains different curation statuses

column.name: NAME
column.remarks: short name to be displayed to use for the interface

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.remarks: a longer explanation of the status

column.name: RANK
column.remarks: a ordinal value used to indicate the relative level of completness for different curation levels

table.name: CURATED_GENE_PROBE_REL_V
table.viewSql: create view db2inst1.curated_gene_probe_rel_v as (select x.umbrella_gene_id, x.umbrella_gene_symbol, x.feature_id as gene_id, x.name as gene_symbol, x.organism_id as species_id, cast(null as integer) as mRNA_id, p.feature_id as probe_id, p.cdna_id, p.cdna_name, cast('Gene to Probe' as VARCHAR(20)) AS connection_type, coalesce(x.umbrella_gene_id,p.cdna_id) as expressed_feature_id, coalesce(x.umbrella_gene_symbol,p.cdna_name) as expressed_feature_name from xen_gene_v x, feature_relationship fr, full_cdna_probe_v p where x.feature_id = fr.object_id and fr.type_id = 607 and fr.subject_id = p.feature_id and p.type_id = 553 UNION select gp.feature_id as umbrella_gene_id, gp.name as umbrella_gene_symbol, cast(null as integer) as gene_id, cast(null as VARCHAR(255)) as gene_symbol, cast(11 as integer) as species_id, cast(null as integer) as mRNA_id, p.feature_id as probe_id, p.cdna_id, p.cdna_name, cast('Umbrella to Probe' as VARCHAR(20)) AS connection_type, coalesce(gp.feature_id,p.cdna_id) as expressed_feature_id, coalesce(gp.name,p.cdna_name) as expressed_feature_name from db2inst1.genepage_v gp, feature_relationship fr, full_cdna_probe_v p where gp.feature_id = fr.object_id and fr.type_id = 607 and fr.subject_id = p.feature_id and p.type_id = 553 )

table.name: CURATION
table.remarks: stores a annotation status and note that can be created for any table record

column.name: NOTE
column.remarks: holds a free text note on annotation

column.name: ANNOTATION_STATUS_ID
column.remarks: the current status of a curation record

column.name: CREATED_AT
column.remarks: creation time

column.name: MODIFIED_BY
column.remarks: id of person in xenbase to last modify the record, null if never modified at

column.name: CREATED_BY
column.remarks: Person in Xenbase that created record

column.name: MODIFIED_AT
column.remarks: time that the record was last modified

table.name: CURATION_HISTORY
table.remarks: Stores all prior curation records, even after deletion of curation record

column.name: CREATED_AT
column.remarks: creation time

column.name: MODIFIED_BY
column.remarks: id of person in xenbase to last modify the record, null if never modified at

column.name: CREATED_BY
column.remarks: Person in Xenbase that created record

column.name: MODIFIED_AT
column.remarks: time that the record was last modified

table.name: CURATION_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.CURATION_incl_del_v (CURATION_ID, TAB_NAME, ROW_ID, NOTE, ANNOTATION_STATUS_ID, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, CREATED_BY, MODIFIED_AT, SELECTABLE,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.CURATION_ID, t.TAB_NAME, t.ROW_ID, t.NOTE, t.ANNOTATION_STATUS_ID, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.CREATED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, t.SELECTABLE, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.CURATION t UNION SELECT a.CURATION_ID, a.TAB_NAME, a.ROW_ID, a.NOTE, a.ANNOTATION_STATUS_ID, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.CREATED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT, a.SELECTABLE,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_CURATION a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: CURATION_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.CURATION_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (CURATION_ID, TAB_NAME, ROW_ID, NOTE, ANNOTATION_STATUS_ID, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, CREATED_BY, MODIFIED_AT, SELECTABLE,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.CURATION_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: CV
table.remarks: A controlled vocabulary or ontology. A cv is composed of cvterms (aka terms, classes, concepts, frames) and the relationships between them

column.name: NAME
column.remarks: The name of the ontology. This corresponds to the obo-format -namespace-. cv names are unique

column.name: DEFINITION
column.remarks: A description of the criteria for membership of this ontology

column.name: PREFIX
column.remarks: A Prefix usualy preceeding the id of this database

table.name: CV_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.CV_incl_del_v (CV_ID, NAME, VERSION, VERSION_TS, PREFIX, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.CV_ID, t.NAME, t.VERSION, t.VERSION_TS, t.PREFIX, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.CV t UNION SELECT a.CV_ID, a.NAME, a.VERSION, a.VERSION_TS, a.PREFIX, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_CV a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: CV_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.CV_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (CV_ID, NAME, VERSION, VERSION_TS, PREFIX, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.CV_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: CVTERM
table.remarks: A term, class or concept within an ontology or controlled vocabulary. Also used for relationship types. A cvterm can also be thought of as a node in a graph

column.name: CV_ID
column.remarks: The cv/ontology/namespace to which this cvterm belongs

column.name: NAME
column.remarks: A concise human-readable name describing the meaning of the cvterm

column.name: DEFINITION
column.remarks: A human-readable text definition

column.name: DBXREF_ID
column.remarks: Primary dbxref - The unique global OBO identifier for this cvterm. Note that a cvterm may have multiple secondary dbxrefs - see also table: cvterm_dbxref

column.name: IS_OBSOLETE
column.remarks: Boolean 0=false,1=true; see GO documentation for details of obsoletion. note that two terms with different primary dbxrefs may exist if one is obsolete

column.name: IS_RELATIONSHIPTYPE
column.remarks: Boolean 0=false,1=true Relationship types (also known as Typedefs in OBO format, or as properties or slots) form a cv/ontology in themselves. We use this flag to indicate whethe this cvterm is an actual term/concept or a relationship type

column.name: IS_ROOT
column.remarks: indicates whether this is the root node/term of an ontology

table.name: CVTERM_CATEGORY
table.remarks: This table is for slims (in obo terms) or subvocabularies

table.name: CVTERM_CATEGORY_TERM
table.remarks: Indicates what term is in a particular subvocabulary

table.name: CVTERM_DBXREF
table.remarks: In addition to the primary identifier (cvterm.dbxref_id) a cvterm can have zero or more secondary identifiers, which may be in external databases

column.name: IS_FOR_DEFINITION
column.remarks: A cvterm.definition should be supported by one or more references. If this column is true, the dbxref is not for a term in an external db - it is a dbxref for provenance information for the definition

table.name: CVTERM_DBXREF_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.CVTERM_DBXREF_incl_del_v (CVTERM_DBXREF_ID, CVTERM_ID, DBXREF_ID, IS_FOR_DEFINITION, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.CVTERM_DBXREF_ID, t.CVTERM_ID, t.DBXREF_ID, t.IS_FOR_DEFINITION, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.CVTERM_DBXREF t UNION SELECT a.CVTERM_DBXREF_ID, a.CVTERM_ID, a.DBXREF_ID, a.IS_FOR_DEFINITION, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_CVTERM_DBXREF a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: CVTERM_DBXREF_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.CVTERM_DBXREF_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (CVTERM_DBXREF_ID, CVTERM_ID, DBXREF_ID, IS_FOR_DEFINITION, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.CVTERM_DBXREF_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: CVTERM_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW "DB2INST1"."CVTERM_INCL_DEL_V" ("CVTERM_ID", "CV_ID", "NAME", "DEFINITION", "DBXREF_ID", "IS_OBSOLETE", "IS_RELATIONSHIPTYPE", "IS_ROOT", "CREATED_BY", "CREATED_AT", "MODIFIED_BY", "MODIFIED_AT", "TRANSACTION_DATE", "TRANSACTION_TYPE") AS SELECT t.CVTERM_ID, t.CV_ID, t.NAME, t.DEFINITION, t.DBXREF_ID, t.IS_OBSOLETE, t.IS_RELATIONSHIPTYPE, t.IS_ROOT, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.CVTERM t UNION SELECT a.CVTERM_ID, a.CV_ID, a.NAME, a.DEFINITION, a.DBXREF_ID, a.IS_OBSOLETE, a.IS_RELATIONSHIPTYPE, a.IS_ROOT, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_CVTERM a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: CVTERM_RELATIONSHIP
table.remarks: A relationship linking two cvterms. A relationship can be thought of as an edge in a graph, or as a natural language statement about two cvterms. The statement is of the form SUBJECT PREDICATE OBJECT; for example ""wing part_of body""

column.name: TYPE_ID
column.remarks: relationship type between subject and object. This is a cvterm, typically from the OBO relationship ontology, although other relationship types are allowed

column.name: SUBJECT_ID
column.remarks: the subject of the subj-predicate-obj sentence. In a DAG, this corresponds to the child node

column.name: OBJECT_ID
column.remarks: the object of the subj-predicate-obj sentence. In a DAG, this corresponds to the parent node

table.name: CVTERM_RELATIONSHIP_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.CVTERM_RELATIONSHIP_incl_del_v (CVTERM_RELATIONSHIP_ID, TYPE_ID, SUBJECT_ID, OBJECT_ID, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.CVTERM_RELATIONSHIP_ID, t.TYPE_ID, t.SUBJECT_ID, t.OBJECT_ID, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.CVTERM_RELATIONSHIP t UNION SELECT a.CVTERM_RELATIONSHIP_ID, a.TYPE_ID, a.SUBJECT_ID, a.OBJECT_ID, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_CVTERM_RELATIONSHIP a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: CVTERM_RELATIONSHIP_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.CVTERM_RELATIONSHIP_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (CVTERM_RELATIONSHIP_ID, TYPE_ID, SUBJECT_ID, OBJECT_ID, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.CVTERM_RELATIONSHIP_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: CVTERM_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW "DB2INST1"."CVTERM_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V" ("CVTERM_ID", "CV_ID", "NAME", "DEFINITION", "DBXREF_ID", "IS_OBSOLETE", "IS_RELATIONSHIPTYPE", "IS_ROOT", "CREATED_BY", "CREATED_AT", "MODIFIED_BY", "MODIFIED_AT", "TRANSACTION_DATE", "TRANSACTION_TYPE") AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.CVTERM_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: CVTERM_STATEMENT
table.remarks: entity attribs composition annotation for example XPO cvterm

column.name: CVTERM_STM_ID
column.remarks: pk for table

column.name: CVTERM_ID
column.remarks: cvterm XPO as an example

column.name: CVTERM_DBXREF_ID
column.remarks: dbxref_id for XPO term

column.name: ENTITY_ATTRIBS
column.remarks: ontology accessions that make up the annotation string: PATO_0000587^RO_0000052(XAO_0000179)^RO_0002573(PATO_0000460)

column.name: ENTITY_ATTRIBS_NAME
column.remarks: annotation string text from ontology terms ! decreased size ; inheres_in; eye; has_modifier; abnormal;

table.name: CVTERM_STM_DECOMPOSE
table.remarks: individual segments of annotation string for cvterm composed of ontology accessions representation of intersection_of in owl.

column.name: CVTERM_STMD_ID
column.remarks: pk for table

column.name: CVTERM_STM_ID
column.remarks: fk for record

column.name: CVTERM_DBXREF_ID
column.remarks: dbxref for XPO

column.name: CVTERMSTM_RANK
column.remarks: ordering of annotation strings

column.name: CVTERMSTM_RELATED
column.remarks: ordering of related strings

column.name: ENTITY_1_SUPERTERM_ACC
column.remarks: given PATO_0000587^RO_0000052(XAO_0000179) we store XAO_0000179

column.name: ENTITY_1_SUBTERM_ID
column.remarks: dbxref_id for given ontology accession

column.name: ENTITY_1_SUPERTERM_ID
column.remarks: dbxref_id for given ontology accession

column.name: ENTITY_2_SUBTERM_ID
column.remarks: dbxref_id for given ontology accession

column.name: ENTITY_2_SUPERTERM_ID
column.remarks: dbxref_id for given ontology accession

table.name: CVTERMPATH
table.remarks: The reflexive transitive closure of the cvterm_relationship relation. For a full discussion, see the file populating-cvtermpath.txt in this directory

column.name: TYPE_ID
column.remarks: The relationship type that this is a closure over. If null, then this is a closure over ALL relationship types. If non-null, then this references a relationship cvterm - applies to this relationship AND the OBO_REL:is_a (subclass) relationship

column.name: CV_ID
column.remarks: Closures will mostly be within one cv. If the closure of a relationship traverses a cv, then this refers to the cv of the object_id cvterm

column.name: PATHDISTANCE
column.remarks: The number of steps required to get from the subject cvterm to the object cvterm, counting from zero (reflexive relationship)

table.name: CVTERMPROP
table.remarks: Additional extensible properties can be attached to a cvterm using this table. Corresponds to -AnnotationProperty- in W3C OWL format

column.name: TYPE_ID
column.remarks: The name of the property/slot is a cvterm. The meaning of the property is defined in that cvterm

column.name: VALUE
column.remarks: The value of the property, represented as text. Numeric values are converted to their text representation

column.name: RANK
column.remarks: Property-Value ordering. Any cvterm can have multiple values for any particular property type - these are ordered in a list using rank, counting from zero. For properties that are single-valued rather than multi-valued, the default 0 value should be used

table.name: CVTERMPROP_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.CVTERMPROP_incl_del_v (CVTERMPROP_ID, CVTERM_ID, TYPE_ID, VALUE, RANK, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.CVTERMPROP_ID, t.CVTERM_ID, t.TYPE_ID, t.VALUE, t.RANK, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.CVTERMPROP t UNION SELECT a.CVTERMPROP_ID, a.CVTERM_ID, a.TYPE_ID, a.VALUE, a.RANK, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_CVTERMPROP a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: CVTERMPROP_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.CVTERMPROP_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (CVTERMPROP_ID, CVTERM_ID, TYPE_ID, VALUE, RANK, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.CVTERMPROP_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: CVTERMSYNONYM
table.remarks: In addition to the primary name (cvterm.name) there can be a number of alternative aliases or synonyms. For example, -T cell- as a synonym for -T lymphocyte-

column.name: TYPE_ID
column.remarks: A synonym can be exact, narrow or borader than

column.name: SCOPE
column.remarks: describes synonym scope (e.g. EXACT | EXACT SHORT | BROAD | NARROW | RELATED)

table.name: CVTERMSYNONYM_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.CVTERMSYNONYM_incl_del_v (CVTERMSYNONYM_ID, CVTERM_ID, SYNONYM, TYPE_ID, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.CVTERMSYNONYM_ID, t.CVTERM_ID, t.SYNONYM, t.TYPE_ID, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.CVTERMSYNONYM t UNION SELECT a.CVTERMSYNONYM_ID, a.CVTERM_ID, a.SYNONYM, a.TYPE_ID, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_CVTERMSYNONYM a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: CVTERMSYNONYM_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.CVTERMSYNONYM_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (CVTERMSYNONYM_ID, CVTERM_ID, SYNONYM, TYPE_ID, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.CVTERMSYNONYM_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: DB
table.remarks: Names of databases

column.name: ORGANIZATION_ID
column.remarks: Organization that managers the DB.

column.name: EXTERNAL_RESOURCE_FLAG
column.remarks: flag as 1 for external resource else 0

table.name: DB_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.DB_incl_del_v (DB_ID, NAME, DESCRIPTION, URLPREFIX, URL, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT, ORGANIZATION_ID, VERSION,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.DB_ID, t.NAME, t.DESCRIPTION, t.URLPREFIX, t.URL, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, t.ORGANIZATION_ID, t.VERSION, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.DB t UNION SELECT a.DB_ID, a.NAME, a.DESCRIPTION, a.URLPREFIX, a.URL, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT, a.ORGANIZATION_ID, a.VERSION,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_DB a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: DB_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.DB_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (DB_ID, NAME, DESCRIPTION, URLPREFIX, URL, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT, ORGANIZATION_ID, VERSION,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.DB_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: DBXREF
table.remarks: References to external databases, ontology identifiers or webpages

column.name: IS_SECONDARY
column.remarks: accession alias to another term when flag set to 1

checkConstraint.constraint: NOT(DBXREF_ID in (98,99, 104) AND DESCRIPTION IS NULL)
checkConstraint.name: DESCRIPTION_CHK

table.name: DBXREF_IDX4_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW "DB2INST1"."DBXREF_IDX4_V"("K00") AS SELECT LOWER(ACCESSION) FROM "DB2INST1"."DBXREF"

table.name: DBXREF_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.DBXREF_incl_del_v (DBXREF_ID, DB_ID, ACCESSION, VERSION, DESCRIPTION, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.DBXREF_ID, t.DB_ID, t.ACCESSION, t.VERSION, t.DESCRIPTION, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.DBXREF t UNION SELECT a.DBXREF_ID, a.DB_ID, a.ACCESSION, a.VERSION, a.DESCRIPTION, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_DBXREF a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: DBXREF_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.DBXREF_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (DBXREF_ID, DB_ID, ACCESSION, VERSION, DESCRIPTION, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.DBXREF_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: DBXREFPROP
table.remarks: Metadata about a dbxref. Note that this is not defined in the dbxref module, as it depends on the cvterm table. This table has a structure analagous to cvtermprop

table.name: DBXREFPROP_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.DBXREFPROP_incl_del_v (DBXREFPROP_ID, DBXREF_ID, TYPE_ID, VALUE, RANK, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.DBXREFPROP_ID, t.DBXREF_ID, t.TYPE_ID, t.VALUE, t.RANK, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.DBXREFPROP t UNION SELECT a.DBXREFPROP_ID, a.DBXREF_ID, a.TYPE_ID, a.VALUE, a.RANK, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_DBXREFPROP a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: DBXREFPROP_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.DBXREFPROP_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (DBXREFPROP_ID, DBXREF_ID, TYPE_ID, VALUE, RANK, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.DBXREFPROP_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: DELETED_PERSON
table.viewSql: create view db2inst1.deleted_person as select * from audit_person where transaction_type='D'

table.name: DFEATURELOC
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW dfeatureloc ( featureloc_id, feature_id, srcfeature_id, nbeg, is_nbeg_partial, nend, is_nend_partial, strand, phase, residue_info, locgroup, rank ) AS SELECT featureloc_id, feature_id, srcfeature_id, fmin, is_fmin_partial, fmax, is_fmax_partial, strand, phase, residue_info, locgroup, rank FROM featureloc WHERE (strand < 0 or phase < 0) UNION ALL SELECT featureloc_id, feature_id, srcfeature_id, fmax, is_fmax_partial, fmin, is_fmin_partial, strand, phase, residue_info, locgroup, rank FROM featureloc WHERE (strand is NULL or strand >= 0 or phase >= 0)

table.name: DISEASE_ARTICLE_LIST_V
table.viewSql: create or replace view db2inst1.disease_article_list_v as with m1 as ( select upper(c.name) DESCRIPTION ,c.cvterm_id ,d.dbxref_id --doid_dbxref_id ,d.db_id ,d.accession , coalesce(ETL_STAGE.GET_DO_ARTICLE_COUNT(c.cvterm_id) , 0 ) article_count from cvterm c, dbxref d where c.dbxref_id=d.dbxref_id and d.db_id=754 ), results as ( select m1.*, t2.* from m1 , TABLE( ETL_STAGE.GET_DO_ARTICLE_LIST(m1.cvterm_id) ) t2 ) select * from results

table.name: DISEASE_ARTICLE_STATS_V
table.viewSql: create or replace view db2inst1.disease_article_stats_v as select upper(c.name) DESCRIPTION ,c.cvterm_id ,d.dbxref_id --doid_dbxref_id ,d.db_id ,d.accession , coalesce(ETL_STAGE.GET_DO_ARTICLE_COUNT(c.cvterm_id) , 0 ) article_count from cvterm c, dbxref d where c.dbxref_id=d.dbxref_id and d.db_id=754

table.name: EST_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW db2inst1.EST_V AS (SELECT * FROM feature WHERE type_id = 822)

table.name: EVIDENCE
table.remarks: evidence of an assertion

column.name: ROW_ID
column.remarks: row in the table (defined in evidence type) that provides the evidence

column.name: ASSERTION_ID
column.remarks: Id of the assertion that the evidence supports

table.name: EVIDENCE_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.EVIDENCE_incl_del_v (EVIDENCE_ID, ROW_ID, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT, EVIDENCE_TYPE_ID, ASSERTION_ID,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.EVIDENCE_ID, t.ROW_ID, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, t.EVIDENCE_TYPE_ID, t.ASSERTION_ID, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.EVIDENCE t UNION SELECT a.EVIDENCE_ID, a.ROW_ID, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT, a.EVIDENCE_TYPE_ID, a.ASSERTION_ID,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_EVIDENCE a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: EVIDENCE_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.EVIDENCE_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (EVIDENCE_ID, ROW_ID, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT, EVIDENCE_TYPE_ID, ASSERTION_ID,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.EVIDENCE_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: EVIDENCE_TYPE
table.remarks: Type of evidence that supports a particular assertion

column.name: NAME
column.remarks: name of evidence type

column.name: TAB_NAME
column.remarks: table containing this evidence type

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.remarks: description of the evidence

column.name: RATIONALE
column.remarks: explanation of why something is evidence

column.name: ASSERTION_TYPE_ID
column.remarks: assertion that this evidence type supports

table.name: EVIDENCE_TYPE_COLUMNS
table.remarks: Columns that are evidence of an assertion if the evidence is specific to particular columns in a record as opposed to the entire record (this should be rare).

column.name: COL_NAME
column.remarks: name of column that is part of the evidence

table.name: EVIDENCE_TYPE_COLUMNS_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.EVIDENCE_TYPE_COLUMNS_incl_del_v (EVIDENCE_TYPE_ID, COL_NAME, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.EVIDENCE_TYPE_ID, t.COL_NAME, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.EVIDENCE_TYPE_COLUMNS t UNION SELECT a.EVIDENCE_TYPE_ID, a.COL_NAME, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_EVIDENCE_TYPE_COLUMNS a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: EVIDENCE_TYPE_COLUMNS_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.EVIDENCE_TYPE_COLUMNS_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (EVIDENCE_TYPE_ID, COL_NAME, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.EVIDENCE_TYPE_COLUMNS_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: EVIDENCE_TYPE_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.EVIDENCE_TYPE_incl_del_v (EVIDENCE_TYPE_ID, NAME, TAB_NAME, DESCRIPTION, RATIONALE, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT, ASSERTION_TYPE_ID,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.EVIDENCE_TYPE_ID, t.NAME, t.TAB_NAME, t.DESCRIPTION, t.RATIONALE, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, t.ASSERTION_TYPE_ID, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.EVIDENCE_TYPE t UNION SELECT a.EVIDENCE_TYPE_ID, a.NAME, a.TAB_NAME, a.DESCRIPTION, a.RATIONALE, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT, a.ASSERTION_TYPE_ID,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_EVIDENCE_TYPE a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: EVIDENCE_TYPE_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.EVIDENCE_TYPE_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (EVIDENCE_TYPE_ID, NAME, TAB_NAME, DESCRIPTION, RATIONALE, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT, ASSERTION_TYPE_ID,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.EVIDENCE_TYPE_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: EXPERIMENT
table.remarks: groups together various items as a single experiment, largely for attribution purposes. Usually, a large scale sceen, or all things in a paper will be a single experiment. An exception might be a paper that reviews prior literature

column.name: EXPERIMENTSOURCE_ID
column.remarks: source type of experiment (e.g. literature, large scale screen, community submission)

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.remarks: describes the experiment's purpose

column.name: CREATED_BY
column.remarks: Person in Xenbase that created record

column.name: CREATED_AT
column.remarks: creation time

column.name: MODIFIED_BY
column.remarks: id of person in xenbase to last modify the record, null if never modified at

column.name: MODIFIED_AT
column.remarks: time that the record was last modified

table.name: EXPERIMENT_DATA_ATTR
table.remarks: holds raw data as a csv field with a reference to the header and context given by gene and experiement

column.name: EXPERIMENT_DATA_ATTR_ID
column.remarks: identify column as PK

column.name: EXPERIMENT_ID
column.remarks: context given by experiment to which data belongs (optional)

column.name: COL_HEADER_CSV
column.remarks: csv field titles for multiple columns in delimited structure

column.name: COL_HEADER_REF
column.remarks: xao reference for each col header giving standard cv naming

column.name: COL_HEADER_SOURCE
column.remarks: such as stage, anatomy_item

column.name: COL_HEADER_COUNT
column.remarks: number of fields that make up the data structure in a given row

column.name: PUBMED_ID
column.remarks: pubmed identifier

column.name: RESOURCE_URL
column.remarks: raw data source URL such as GEO

table.name: EXPERIMENT_DATA_FACT
table.remarks: tpm read values fact table

column.name: GSES_ID
column.remarks: partition key for fact table

column.name: CO_PROP_ID
column.remarks: bin or approach made up of manipulation and assay

column.name: SPECIES_DBXREF_ID
column.remarks: species version dbxref

column.name: GSM_ID
column.remarks: lowest gsm_id that belongs to this co_prop_id

column.name: SEQ_ID
column.remarks: gene model name with species version prefix

column.name: EXPERIMENT_SEQ_GENE_ID
column.remarks: fk to obtain gene feature_id

column.name: VAL_TPM_AVG
column.remarks: TPM avg read

column.name: VAL_TPM_STDDEV
column.remarks: TPM Stddev

column.name: VAL_TPM_READ_COUNT
column.remarks: count of records used to obtain avg from

column.name: VAL_TPM_STAT_A
column.remarks: unused statistic A

column.name: TYP_TPM_STAT_A
column.remarks: statistic A type classification

column.name: VAL_TPM_STAT_B
column.remarks: unused statistic B

column.name: TYP_TPM_STAT_B
column.remarks: statistic B type classification

table.name: EXPERIMENT_DATA_FACT_DE
table.remarks: Differential Expression Fact table for GSE data

column.name: CO_PROP_ID_CTRL
column.remarks: Control group identifier

column.name: CO_PROP_ID_EXP
column.remarks: Experiment group identifier

column.name: VAL_DE_LOGFC
column.remarks: log2 fold change (MLE): condition treated vs untreated

column.name: VAL_DE_LOGCPM
column.remarks: log Counts per million cpm

column.name: VAL_DE_LR
column.remarks: likelihood ratio

column.name: VAL_DE_PVAL
column.remarks: differential expression P-value

column.name: VAL_DE_FDR
column.remarks: false detection rate fdr

table.name: EXPERIMENT_DATA_RAW
table.remarks: holds raw data as a csv field with a reference to the header and context given by gene and experiement

column.name: EXPERIMENT_DATA_RAW_ID
column.remarks: identify column as PK

column.name: GENE_ID
column.remarks: context given by gene to which data belongs (optional)

column.name: SEQ_ID
column.remarks: gene model which can be associated with different genes, as per feature.name

column.name: COL_VALUES_CSV
column.remarks: csv field containing multiple data points in delimited structure

column.name: ATTR_ID
column.remarks: fk reference to header record giving col titles for each element of csv data

table.name: EXPERIMENT_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.EXPERIMENT_incl_del_v (EXPERIMENT_ID, EXPERIMENTSOURCE_ID, DESCRIPTION, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT, TYPE_ID,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.EXPERIMENT_ID, t.EXPERIMENTSOURCE_ID, t.DESCRIPTION, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, t.TYPE_ID, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.EXPERIMENT t UNION SELECT a.EXPERIMENT_ID, a.EXPERIMENTSOURCE_ID, a.DESCRIPTION, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT, a.TYPE_ID,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_EXPERIMENT a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: EXPERIMENT_SEQ_GENE
table.remarks: SEQ_ID to GENE_ID relationship

table.name: EXPERIMENT_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.EXPERIMENT_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (EXPERIMENT_ID, EXPERIMENTSOURCE_ID, DESCRIPTION, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT, TYPE_ID,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.EXPERIMENT_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: EXPERIMENTSOURCE
table.remarks: describes the types of experiment sources (e.g large scale screens, literature, community submission)

column.name: NAME
column.remarks: This restricts the type of experiment source (publication, large scale screen, community submission)

table.name: EXPERIMENTSOURCE_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.EXPERIMENTSOURCE_incl_del_v (EXPERIMENTSOURCE_ID, NAME, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_AT, CREATED_BY, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.EXPERIMENTSOURCE_ID, t.NAME, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_AT, t.CREATED_BY, t.MODIFIED_BY, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.EXPERIMENTSOURCE t UNION SELECT a.EXPERIMENTSOURCE_ID, a.NAME, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_AT, a.CREATED_BY, a.MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_EXPERIMENTSOURCE a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: EXPERIMENTSOURCE_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.EXPERIMENTSOURCE_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (EXPERIMENTSOURCE_ID, NAME, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_AT, CREATED_BY, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.EXPERIMENTSOURCE_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: EXPRESSION_DELETE_EXEMPTED_USERS
table.remarks: Table contains a list of person_ids, any expression records created under these ids will not be allowed to be deleted by users, only edited

table.name: EXPRESSION_IMAGES_A_V
table.viewSql: CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW expression_images_a_v as ( select sp.*, ap.expressionassay_id, ap.anatomy_item_id, ap.anatomy_item , CASE WHEN ap.biomedia_id is not null THEN RTRIM(cast(sp.expressionstagestested_id as char(15))) || RTRIM(cast(ap.biomedia_id as char(15))) ELSE RTRIM(cast(sp.expressionstagestested_id as char(15))) END as image_pattern_id from stage_pattern_a_v sp left join anatomy_pattern_a_v ap ON sp.biomedia_id=ap.biomedia_id and sp.expressionstagestested_id=ap.expressionstagestested_id )

table.name: EXPRESSION_IMAGES_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW expression_images_v as ( select sp.*, ap.expressionassay_id, ap.anatomy_item_id, ap.anatomy_item, CASE WHEN ap.biomedia_id is not null THEN RTRIM(cast(sp.expressionstagestested_id as char(15))) || RTRIM(cast(ap.biomedia_id as char(15))) ELSE RTRIM(cast(sp.expressionstagestested_id as char(15))) END as image_pattern_id from stage_pattern_v sp left join anatomy_pattern_v ap ON sp.biomedia_id=ap.biomedia_id and sp.expressionstagestested_id=ap.expressionstagestested_id )

table.name: EXPRESSION_PROBE_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW expression_probe_v AS ( select et.feature_id as probe_id from expressiontest et )

table.name: EXPRESSION_STAGES_TESTED
table.remarks: This indicates a set of stages for which expression was tested for an expression test of a feature and specimen. This corresponds to a specimen stages entry.

column.name: CREATED_BY
column.remarks: Person in Xenbase that created record

column.name: CREATED_AT
column.remarks: creation time

column.name: MODIFIED_BY
column.remarks: id of person in xenbase to last modify the record, null if never modified at

column.name: MODIFIED_AT
column.remarks: time that the record was last modified

table.name: EXPRESSION_STAGES_TESTED_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.EXPRESSION_STAGES_TESTED_incl_del_v (EXPRESSIONSTAGESTESTED_ID, EXPRESSIONTEST_ID, SPECIMENSTAGES_ID, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.EXPRESSIONSTAGESTESTED_ID, t.EXPRESSIONTEST_ID, t.SPECIMENSTAGES_ID, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.EXPRESSION_STAGES_TESTED t UNION SELECT a.EXPRESSIONSTAGESTESTED_ID, a.EXPRESSIONTEST_ID, a.SPECIMENSTAGES_ID, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_EXPRESSION_STAGES_TESTED a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: EXPRESSION_STAGES_TESTED_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.EXPRESSION_STAGES_TESTED_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (EXPRESSIONSTAGESTESTED_ID, EXPRESSIONTEST_ID, SPECIMENSTAGES_ID, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.EXPRESSION_STAGES_TESTED_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: EXPRESSION_TEST_EXPERIMENTOR_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW "DB2INST1"."EXPRESSION_TEST_EXPERIMENTOR_V" ("EXPRESSIONTEST_ID", "SOURCE_ID", "EXPERIMENTOR", "SOURCE_TYPE") AS SELECT DISTINCT et.expressiontest_id , p.person_id AS source_id , CAST(p.full_name AS VARCHAR(255)) AS experimentor, a.source_name AS source_type FROM expressiontest et , expression_stages_tested est, biomedia_specimenstages bs , biomedia b , attribution a , person p WHERE est.expressiontest_id=et.expressiontest_id AND bs.specimenstages_id =est.specimenstages_id AND b.biomedia_id =bs.biomedia_id AND a.object_row_id =INTEGER(b.image_id) AND a.object_name ='IMAGE' AND a.source_name ='PERSON' AND a.source_row_id =INTEGER(p.person_id) UNION SELECT DISTINCT et.expressiontest_id , l.lab_id AS source_id , CAST(l.name AS VARCHAR(255)) AS experimentor, a.source_name AS source_type FROM expressiontest et , expression_stages_tested est, biomedia_specimenstages bs , biomedia b , attribution a , lab l WHERE est.expressiontest_id=et.expressiontest_id AND bs.specimenstages_id =est.specimenstages_id AND b.biomedia_id =bs.biomedia_id AND a.object_row_id =INTEGER(b.image_id) AND a.object_name ='IMAGE' AND a.source_name ='LAB' AND a.source_row_id =INTEGER(l.lab_id) UNION SELECT DISTINCT et.expressiontest_id , o.organization_id AS source_id , CAST(o.name AS VARCHAR(255)) AS experimentor, a.source_name AS source_type FROM expressiontest et , expression_stages_tested est, biomedia_specimenstages bs , biomedia b , attribution a , organization o WHERE est.expressiontest_id=et.expressiontest_id AND bs.specimenstages_id =est.specimenstages_id AND b.biomedia_id =bs.biomedia_id AND a.object_row_id =INTEGER(b.image_id) AND a.object_name ='IMAGE' AND a.source_name ='ORGANIZATION' AND a.source_row_id =INTEGER(o.organization_id) UNION SELECT DISTINCT et.expressiontest_id , p.person_id AS source_id , CAST(p.full_name AS VARCHAR(255)) AS experimentor, a.source_name AS source_type FROM expressiontest et , expression_stages_tested est, biomedia_specimenstages bs , biomedia b , attribution a , paper_author pa, person_author pea, person p WHERE est.expressiontest_id=et.expressiontest_id AND bs.specimenstages_id =est.specimenstages_id AND b.biomedia_id =bs.biomedia_id AND a.object_row_id =INTEGER(b.image_id) AND a.object_name ='IMAGE' AND a.source_name ='PAPER' AND a.source_row_id =INTEGER(pa.paper_id) AND pea.paperauthor_id = pa.paperauthor_id AND p.person_id = pea.person_id

table.name: EXPRESSIONASSAY_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.EXPRESSIONASSAY_incl_del_v (EXPRESSIONASSAY_ID, ANATOMY_ITEM_ID, EXPRESSIONSTAGESTESTED_ID, NOT_EXPRESSED, DESCRIPTION, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT, BIOMEDIA_ID,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.EXPRESSIONASSAY_ID, t.ANATOMY_ITEM_ID, t.EXPRESSIONSTAGESTESTED_ID, t.NOT_EXPRESSED, t.DESCRIPTION, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, t.BIOMEDIA_ID, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.EXPRESSIONASSAY t UNION SELECT a.EXPRESSIONASSAY_ID, a.ANATOMY_ITEM_ID, a.EXPRESSIONSTAGESTESTED_ID, a.NOT_EXPRESSED, a.DESCRIPTION, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT, a.BIOMEDIA_ID,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_EXPRESSIONASSAY a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: EXPRESSIONASSAY_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.EXPRESSIONASSAY_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (EXPRESSIONASSAY_ID, ANATOMY_ITEM_ID, EXPRESSIONSTAGESTESTED_ID, NOT_EXPRESSED, DESCRIPTION, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT, BIOMEDIA_ID,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.EXPRESSIONASSAY_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: EXPRESSIONTEST
table.remarks: indicates a test for expression between some type of sequence (nucleotide/protein) and a specimen.

column.name: CREATED_BY
column.remarks: Person in Xenbase that created record

column.name: CREATED_AT
column.remarks: creation time

column.name: MODIFIED_BY
column.remarks: id of person in xenbase to last modify the record, null if never modified at

column.name: MODIFIED_AT
column.remarks: time that the record was last modified

table.name: F_LOC
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW "DB2INST1"."F_LOC" ("FEATURE_ID", "NAME", "DBXREF_ID", "NBEG", "NEND", "STRAND") AS SELECT f.feature_id, f.name, f.dbxref_id, fl.nbeg, fl.nend, fl.strand FROM dfeatureloc fl, f_type f WHERE f.feature_id = fl.feature_id

table.name: F_TYPE
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW "DB2INST1"."F_TYPE" ("FEATURE_ID", "NAME", "DBXREF_ID", "TYPE", "RESIDUES", "SEQLEN", "MD5CHECKSUM", "TYPE_ID", "TIMEACCESSIONED", "TIMELASTMODIFIED") AS SELECT f.feature_id, f.name, f.dbxref_id, c.name AS type, f.residues, f.seqlen, f.md5checksum, f.type_id, f.timeaccessioned, f.timelastmodified FROM feature f, cvterm c WHERE f.type_id = c.cvterm_id

table.name: FEATURE
table.remarks: A feature is a biological sequence or a section of a biological sequence, or a collection of such sections.see the Sequence Ontology for more

column.name: DBXREF_ID
column.remarks: An optional primary public stable identifier for this feature. Secondary identifiers and external dbxrefs go in table:feature_dbxref

column.name: ORGANISM_ID
column.remarks: The organism to which this feature belongs. This column is mandatory

column.name: NAME
column.remarks: The optional human-readable common name for a feature, for display purposes

column.name: UNIQUENAME
column.remarks: The unique name for a feature; may not be necessarily be particularly human-readable, although this is prefered. This name must be unique for this type of feature within this organism

column.name: RESIDUES
column.remarks: A sequence of characters representing nucleic or amino acids. It is optional for features where the residues can be derived (eg exons)but s/b manifested for features which may have non-contiguous sublocations 9eg transcripts). DNA not RNA s/b used

column.name: SEQLEN
column.remarks: This column is redundant to residue but is required because the location may be unknown or residue not manifested. The seqlen should always be manifested where the length of the sequence is known

column.name: MD5CHECKSUM
column.remarks: The 32-character checksum of the sequence, calculated using the MD5 algorithm. This is practically guaranteed to be unique for any feature. This column thus acts as a unique identifier on the mathematical sequence

column.name: TYPE_ID
column.remarks: A required reference to a table:cvterm giving the feature type. This will typically be a Sequence Ontology identifier. This column is thus used to subclass the feature table

column.name: IS_ANALYSIS
column.remarks: see FEATURE_IS_ANALYSIS_CODE for definitions

column.name: IS_OBSOLETE
column.remarks: Boolean indicating whether this feature has been obsoleted. Some chado instances may choose to simply remove the feature altogether, others may choose to keep an obsolete row in the table

column.name: TIMEACCESSIONED
column.remarks: for handling object accession/modification timestamps (as opposed to db auditing info, handled elsewhere). The expectation is that these fields would be available to software interacting with chado

column.name: TIMELASTMODIFIED
column.remarks: for handling object accession/modification timestamps (as opposed to db auditing info, handled elsewhere). The expectation is that these fields would be available to software interacting with chado

table.name: FEATURE_ANATOMY_ITEM
table.remarks: Associate a term from an anatomy_item with a feature, for example, XAO annotation of an Antibody

table.name: FEATURE_CVTERM
table.remarks: Associate a term from a cv with a feature, for example, GO annotation

column.name: PUB_ID
column.remarks: This column is obsolete and exists only to avoid table reorganization. The only allowed value is 1.

table.name: FEATURE_CVTERM_DBXREF
table.remarks: Additional dbxrefs for an association. Rows in the feature_cvterm table may be backed up by dbxrefs. see sequence.sql for additionnal comments

table.name: FEATURE_CVTERM_DBXREF_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.FEATURE_CVTERM_DBXREF_incl_del_v (FEATURE_CVTERM_DBXREF_ID, FEATURE_CVTERM_ID, DBXREF_ID, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_AT, CREATED_BY, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.FEATURE_CVTERM_DBXREF_ID, t.FEATURE_CVTERM_ID, t.DBXREF_ID, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_AT, t.CREATED_BY, t.MODIFIED_BY, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.FEATURE_CVTERM_DBXREF t UNION SELECT a.FEATURE_CVTERM_DBXREF_ID, a.FEATURE_CVTERM_ID, a.DBXREF_ID, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_AT, a.CREATED_BY, a.MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_FEATURE_CVTERM_DBXREF a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: FEATURE_CVTERM_DBXREF_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.FEATURE_CVTERM_DBXREF_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (FEATURE_CVTERM_DBXREF_ID, FEATURE_CVTERM_ID, DBXREF_ID, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_AT, CREATED_BY, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.FEATURE_CVTERM_DBXREF_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: FEATURE_CVTERM_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.FEATURE_CVTERM_incl_del_v (FEATURE_CVTERM_ID, FEATURE_ID, CVTERM_ID, PUB_ID, IS_NOT, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.FEATURE_CVTERM_ID, t.FEATURE_ID, t.CVTERM_ID, t.PUB_ID, t.IS_NOT, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.FEATURE_CVTERM t UNION SELECT a.FEATURE_CVTERM_ID, a.FEATURE_ID, a.CVTERM_ID, a.PUB_ID, a.IS_NOT, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_FEATURE_CVTERM a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: FEATURE_CVTERM_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.FEATURE_CVTERM_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (FEATURE_CVTERM_ID, FEATURE_ID, CVTERM_ID, PUB_ID, IS_NOT, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.FEATURE_CVTERM_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: FEATURE_CVTERMPROP
table.remarks: Extensible properties for feature to cvterm associations. Examples: GO evidence codes; qualifiers; metadata such as the date on which the entry was curated and the source of the association

table.name: FEATURE_CVTERMPROP_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.FEATURE_CVTERMPROP_incl_del_v (FEATURE_CVTERMPROP_ID, FEATURE_CVTERM_ID, TYPE_ID, VALUE, RANK, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.FEATURE_CVTERMPROP_ID, t.FEATURE_CVTERM_ID, t.TYPE_ID, t.VALUE, t.RANK, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.FEATURE_CVTERMPROP t UNION SELECT a.FEATURE_CVTERMPROP_ID, a.FEATURE_CVTERM_ID, a.TYPE_ID, a.VALUE, a.RANK, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_FEATURE_CVTERMPROP a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: FEATURE_CVTERMPROP_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.FEATURE_CVTERMPROP_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (FEATURE_CVTERMPROP_ID, FEATURE_CVTERM_ID, TYPE_ID, VALUE, RANK, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.FEATURE_CVTERMPROP_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: FEATURE_DBXREF
table.remarks: links a feature to dbxrefs. This is for secondary identifiers; primary identifiers should use feature.dbxref_id

table.name: FEATURE_DBXREF_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.FEATURE_DBXREF_incl_del_v (FEATURE_DBXREF_ID, FEATURE_ID, DBXREF_ID, IS_CURRENT, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.FEATURE_DBXREF_ID, t.FEATURE_ID, t.DBXREF_ID, t.IS_CURRENT, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.FEATURE_DBXREF t UNION SELECT a.FEATURE_DBXREF_ID, a.FEATURE_ID, a.DBXREF_ID, a.IS_CURRENT, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_FEATURE_DBXREF a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: FEATURE_DBXREF_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.FEATURE_DBXREF_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (FEATURE_DBXREF_ID, FEATURE_ID, DBXREF_ID, IS_CURRENT, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.FEATURE_DBXREF_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: FEATURE_FX1_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW "DB2INST1"."FEATURE_FX1_V"("K00") AS SELECT LOWER("NAME") FROM "DB2INST1"."FEATURE"

table.name: FEATURE_IMAGE
table.remarks: stores the relationships between features and images

column.name: ARCHETYPE
column.remarks: indicates if this is the main sample image for a gene, only one image per feature should have this as true

table.name: FEATURE_IMAGE_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.FEATURE_IMAGE_incl_del_v (FEATUREIMAGE_ID, FEATURE_ID, IMAGE_ID, ARCHETYPE, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_AT, CREATED_BY, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.FEATUREIMAGE_ID, t.FEATURE_ID, t.IMAGE_ID, t.ARCHETYPE, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_AT, t.CREATED_BY, t.MODIFIED_BY, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.FEATURE_IMAGE t UNION SELECT a.FEATUREIMAGE_ID, a.FEATURE_ID, a.IMAGE_ID, a.ARCHETYPE, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_AT, a.CREATED_BY, a.MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_FEATURE_IMAGE a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: FEATURE_IMAGE_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.FEATURE_IMAGE_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (FEATUREIMAGE_ID, FEATURE_ID, IMAGE_ID, ARCHETYPE, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_AT, CREATED_BY, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.FEATURE_IMAGE_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: FEATURE_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.FEATURE_incl_del_v (FEATURE_ID, DBXREF_ID, ORGANISM_ID, NAME, UNIQUENAME, SEQLEN, MD5CHECKSUM, TYPE_ID, IS_ANALYSIS, IS_OBSOLETE, TIMEACCESSIONED, TIMELASTMODIFIED, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT, FULL_NAME, DESCRIPTION, SORTABLE_NAME,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.FEATURE_ID, t.DBXREF_ID, t.ORGANISM_ID, t.NAME, t.UNIQUENAME, t.SEQLEN, t.MD5CHECKSUM, t.TYPE_ID, t.IS_ANALYSIS, t.IS_OBSOLETE, t.TIMEACCESSIONED, t.TIMELASTMODIFIED, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, t.FULL_NAME, t.DESCRIPTION, t.SORTABLE_NAME, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.FEATURE t UNION SELECT a.FEATURE_ID, a.DBXREF_ID, a.ORGANISM_ID, a.NAME, a.UNIQUENAME, a.SEQLEN, a.MD5CHECKSUM, a.TYPE_ID, a.IS_ANALYSIS, a.IS_OBSOLETE, a.TIMEACCESSIONED, a.TIMELASTMODIFIED, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT, a.FULL_NAME, a.DESCRIPTION, a.SORTABLE_NAME,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_FEATURE a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: FEATURE_IS_ANALYSIS_CODE
table.remarks: Names of is_analysis codes

column.name: NAME
column.remarks: shortname for code

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.remarks: Meaning of code or definition

table.name: FEATURE_RELATIONSHIP
table.remarks: features can be arranged in graphs, eg exon part_of transcript part_of gene; translation madeby transcript if type is thought of as a verb, each arc makes a statement [SUBJECT VERB OBJECT] ;see sequence.sql code for for full comment.

column.name: SUBJECT_ID
column.remarks: the subject of the subj-predicate-obj sentence. This is typically the subfeature

column.name: OBJECT_ID
column.remarks: the object of the subj-predicate-obj sentence. This is typically the container feature

column.name: TYPE_ID
column.remarks: relationship type between subject and object. This is a cvterm, typically from the OBO rel ont, although other rel. types are allowed. The most common rel type is OBO_REL:part_of.Valid rel. types are constrained by the SO

column.name: VALUE
column.remarks: Additional notes/comments

column.name: RANK
column.remarks: The ordering of subject features with respect to the object feature may be important (for example, exon ordering on a transcript - not always derivable if you take trans spliced genes into consideration). rank is used to order these; starts from zero

table.name: FEATURE_RELATIONSHIP_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.FEATURE_RELATIONSHIP_incl_del_v (FEATURE_RELATIONSHIP_ID, SUBJECT_ID, OBJECT_ID, TYPE_ID, VALUE, RANK, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT, R_RANK,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.FEATURE_RELATIONSHIP_ID, t.SUBJECT_ID, t.OBJECT_ID, t.TYPE_ID, t.VALUE, t.RANK, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, t.R_RANK, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.FEATURE_RELATIONSHIP t UNION SELECT a.FEATURE_RELATIONSHIP_ID, a.SUBJECT_ID, a.OBJECT_ID, a.TYPE_ID, a.VALUE, a.RANK, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT, a.R_RANK,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_FEATURE_RELATIONSHIP a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: FEATURE_RELATIONSHIP_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.FEATURE_RELATIONSHIP_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (FEATURE_RELATIONSHIP_ID, SUBJECT_ID, OBJECT_ID, TYPE_ID, VALUE, RANK, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT, R_RANK,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.FEATURE_RELATIONSHIP_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: FEATURE_RELATIONSHIPPROP
table.remarks: Extensible properties for feature_relationships. Analagous structure to featureprop

table.name: FEATURE_RELATIONSHIPPROP_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.FEATURE_RELATIONSHIPPROP_incl_del_v (FEATURE_RELATIONSHIPPROP_ID, FEATURE_RELATIONSHIP_ID, TYPE_ID, RANK, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.FEATURE_RELATIONSHIPPROP_ID, t.FEATURE_RELATIONSHIP_ID, t.TYPE_ID, t.RANK, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.FEATURE_RELATIONSHIPPROP t UNION SELECT a.FEATURE_RELATIONSHIPPROP_ID, a.FEATURE_RELATIONSHIP_ID, a.TYPE_ID, a.RANK, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_FEATURE_RELATIONSHIPPROP a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: FEATURE_RELATIONSHIPPROP_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.FEATURE_RELATIONSHIPPROP_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (FEATURE_RELATIONSHIPPROP_ID, FEATURE_RELATIONSHIP_ID, TYPE_ID, RANK, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.FEATURE_RELATIONSHIPPROP_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: FEATURE_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.FEATURE_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (FEATURE_ID, DBXREF_ID, ORGANISM_ID, NAME, UNIQUENAME, SEQLEN, MD5CHECKSUM, TYPE_ID, IS_ANALYSIS, IS_OBSOLETE, TIMEACCESSIONED, TIMELASTMODIFIED, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT, FULL_NAME, DESCRIPTION, SORTABLE_NAME,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.FEATURE_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: FEATURE_SUPPLIER
table.remarks: A feature which can be supplied will have a feature supplier relationsip. This stores information such as product name and catalog number. There can be more than one feature suppler relationship between the same suppliers.

column.name: DBXREF_ID
column.remarks: Catalog number at that supplier.

table.name: FEATURE_SYNONYM
table.remarks: Linking table between feature and synonym

column.name: PUB_ID
column.remarks: This column is obsolete and exists only to avoid table reorganization. The only allowed values are 1 or NULL.

column.name: IS_CURRENT
column.remarks: the is_current bit indicates whether the linked synonym is the current -official- symbol for the linked feature

column.name: IS_INTERNAL
column.remarks: typically a synonym exists so that somebody querying the db with an obsolete name can find the object theyre looking for (under its current name. see sequence.sql for full comment

table.name: FEATURE_SYNONYM_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.FEATURE_SYNONYM_incl_del_v (FEATURE_SYNONYM_ID, SYNONYM_ID, FEATURE_ID, PUB_ID, IS_CURRENT, IS_INTERNAL, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.FEATURE_SYNONYM_ID, t.SYNONYM_ID, t.FEATURE_ID, t.PUB_ID, t.IS_CURRENT, t.IS_INTERNAL, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.FEATURE_SYNONYM t UNION SELECT a.FEATURE_SYNONYM_ID, a.SYNONYM_ID, a.FEATURE_ID, a.PUB_ID, a.IS_CURRENT, a.IS_INTERNAL, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_FEATURE_SYNONYM a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: FEATURE_SYNONYM_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.FEATURE_SYNONYM_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (FEATURE_SYNONYM_ID, SYNONYM_ID, FEATURE_ID, PUB_ID, IS_CURRENT, IS_INTERNAL, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.FEATURE_SYNONYM_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: FEATURELOC
table.remarks: The location of a feature relative to another feature. IMPORTANT: INTERBASE COORDINATES ARE USED.(This is vital as it allows us to represent zero-length features eg splice sites, insertion points). see sequence.sql code for for full comment.

column.name: SRCFEATURE_ID
column.remarks: The source feature which this location is relative to. Every location is relative to another feature (however, this column is nullable, because the srcfeature may not be known). see sequence.sql for more information

column.name: FMIN
column.remarks: The leftmost/minimal boundary in the linear range represented by the featureloc. Sometimes this is called -start- because it does not necessarily represent the 5-prime coordinate.see sequence.sql for more information

column.name: IS_FMIN_PARTIAL
column.remarks: This is typically false, but may be true if the value for column:fmin is inaccurate or the leftmost part of the range is unknown/unbounded

column.name: FMAX
column.remarks: The rightmost/maximal boundary in the linear range represented by the featureloc. Sometimes this is called -end- because it does not necessarily represent the 3-prime coordinate.see sequence.sql for more information

column.name: IS_FMAX_PARTIAL
column.remarks: This is typically false, but may be true if the value for column:fmax is inaccurate or the rightmost part of the range is unknown/unbounded

column.name: STRAND
column.remarks: The orientation/directionality of the location. Should be 0,-1 or +1

column.name: PHASE
column.remarks: phase of translation wrt srcfeature_id. Values are 0,1,2. It may not be possible to manifest this column for some features such as exons, because the phase is dependant on the spliceform (the same exon can appear in multiple spliceforms).

column.name: RESIDUE_INFO
column.remarks: Alternative residues, when these differ from feature.residues. e.g: a SNP feature located on a wild and mutant protein would have different alresidues.See sequence.sql for full comment.

column.name: LOCGROUP
column.remarks: This is used to manifest redundant, derivable extra locations for a feature. The default locgroup=0 is used for the DIRECT location of a feature.See sequence.sql for full comment

column.name: RANK
column.remarks: Used when a feature has >1 location, otherwise trank 0 is used. Some features (eg blast hits and HSPs) have two locations - one on the query and one on the subject. See sequence.sql for full comment

table.name: FEATURELOC_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.FEATURELOC_incl_del_v (FEATURELOC_ID, FEATURE_ID, SRCFEATURE_ID, FMIN, IS_FMIN_PARTIAL, FMAX, IS_FMAX_PARTIAL, STRAND, PHASE, LOCGROUP, RANK, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.FEATURELOC_ID, t.FEATURE_ID, t.SRCFEATURE_ID, t.FMIN, t.IS_FMIN_PARTIAL, t.FMAX, t.IS_FMAX_PARTIAL, t.STRAND, t.PHASE, t.LOCGROUP, t.RANK, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.FEATURELOC t UNION SELECT a.FEATURELOC_ID, a.FEATURE_ID, a.SRCFEATURE_ID, a.FMIN, a.IS_FMIN_PARTIAL, a.FMAX, a.IS_FMAX_PARTIAL, a.STRAND, a.PHASE, a.LOCGROUP, a.RANK, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_FEATURELOC a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: FEATURELOC_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.FEATURELOC_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (FEATURELOC_ID, FEATURE_ID, SRCFEATURE_ID, FMIN, IS_FMIN_PARTIAL, FMAX, IS_FMAX_PARTIAL, STRAND, PHASE, LOCGROUP, RANK, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.FEATURELOC_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: FEATUREPATH_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW featurepath_v (object_id, subject_id, distance) AS ( SELECT fr.object_id, fr.subject_id, 1 distance FROM feature p, feature_relationship fr, feature c WHERE p.feature_id = fr.object_id and fr.subject_id = c.feature_id UNION ALL (SELECT fr2.object_id, fr2.subject_id, fp.distance+1 distance FROM featurepath_v fp, feature_relationship fr2, feature f WHERE fp.subject_id=fr2.object_id AND fr2.subject_id=f.feature_id AND distance < 100) )

table.name: FEATUREPROP
table.remarks: A feature can have any number of slot-value property tags attached to it. This is an alternative to hardcoding a list of columns in the relational schema, and is completely extensible

column.name: TYPE_ID
column.remarks: The name of the property/slot is a cvterm. The meaning of the property is defined in that cvterm. Certain properties will only apply to certain feature types; this will be handled by the Sequence Ontology

column.name: VALUE
column.remarks: The value of the property, represented as text. Numeric values are converted to their text representation. This is less efficient than using native database types, but is easier to query.

column.name: RANK
column.remarks: Property-Value ordering. Any feature can have multiple values for any particular property type - these are ordered using rank, counting from zero. For properties that are single-valued rather than multi-valued, 0 s/b used

table.name: FEATUREPROP_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.FEATUREPROP_incl_del_v (FEATUREPROP_ID, FEATURE_ID, TYPE_ID, VALUE, RANK, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.FEATUREPROP_ID, t.FEATURE_ID, t.TYPE_ID, t.VALUE, t.RANK, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.FEATUREPROP t UNION SELECT a.FEATUREPROP_ID, a.FEATURE_ID, a.TYPE_ID, a.VALUE, a.RANK, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_FEATUREPROP a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: FEATUREPROP_PUB
table.remarks: Provenance. Any featureprop assignment can optionally be supported by a publication

table.name: FEATUREPROP_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.FEATUREPROP_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (FEATUREPROP_ID, FEATURE_ID, TYPE_ID, VALUE, RANK, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.FEATUREPROP_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: FEATURESOURCE
table.remarks: Associate a feature with a source or supplier, for example, associate an antibody with a lab that can supply it

table.name: FULL_CDNA_PROBE_V
table.viewSql: create view db2inst1.full_cdna_probe_v as WITH cdna AS (SELECT fr.subject_id, c.feature_id AS cdna_id, c.name as cdna_name FROM feature_relationship fr, cdna_v c WHERE fr.type_id = 607 AND fr.object_id = c.feature_id ) SELECT p.*, cdna.cdna_id, cdna.cdna_name FROM cdna_probe_v P LEFT OUTER JOIN cdna ON p.feature_id = cdna.subject_id

table.name: FULL_CDNA_PROBE_W_CDNA_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW db2inst1.full_cdna_probe_w_cdna_v AS (SELECT p.*, c.feature_id AS cdna_id FROM cdna_probe_v p , feature_relationship fr, cdna_v c WHERE p.feature_id = fr.subject_id AND fr.type_id = 607 AND fr.object_id = c.feature_id )

table.name: FULL_MATCH_V
table.viewSql: create view db2inst1.full_match_v AS select fr1.subject_id participant1_id, fr2.subject_id participant2_id, m.* from feature_relationship fr1, feature m, feature_relationship fr2 where fr1.object_id = m.feature_id and m.type_id = 849 and fr2.object_id = m.feature_id and fr1.feature_relationship_id != fr2.feature_relationship_id

table.name: FULLADDRESS
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW fulladdress AS ( SELECT address.*, country.name as country FROM address, country WHERE address.country_id = country.country_id)

table.name: GENE_GO_MQT
table.remarks: This is an Artificial MQT for Gene and associated GO terms with hash on gene list

table.name: GENE_HP_MQT
table.remarks: This is an Artificial MQT for Gene and associated HPO and MONDO terms via HUMAN GENE

table.name: GENE_IMAGES_V
