table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.LINK_TARGET_ITEM_incl_del_v (LINK_TARGET_ITEM_ID, LINK_TARGET_ID, ROW_ID, MATCH, CREATED_AT, CREATED_BY, MODIFIED_AT, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.LINK_TARGET_ITEM_ID, t.LINK_TARGET_ID, t.ROW_ID, t.MATCH, t.CREATED_AT, t.CREATED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.LINK_TARGET_ITEM t UNION SELECT a.LINK_TARGET_ITEM_ID, a.LINK_TARGET_ID, a.ROW_ID, a.MATCH, a.CREATED_AT, a.CREATED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_LINK_TARGET_ITEM a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: LINK_TARGET_ITEM_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.LINK_TARGET_ITEM_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (LINK_TARGET_ITEM_ID, LINK_TARGET_ID, ROW_ID, MATCH, CREATED_AT, CREATED_BY, MODIFIED_AT, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.LINK_TARGET_ITEM_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: LOCUS_MAP
table.remarks: Temporary for storing some axeldb data for lookup

table.name: MATCHSTATUS
table.remarks: Describes that manner in which the author is matched to a person in Xenbase person table

column.name: MATCHSTATUS_ID
column.remarks: id for match status

column.name: NAME
column.remarks: name of match level

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.remarks: description of the match status

column.name: RANK
column.remarks: rank of status. The higher the rank the more confidence there is in the match. However, it is purely ordinal.

table.name: MATCHSTATUS_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.MATCHSTATUS_incl_del_v (MATCHSTATUS_ID, NAME, DESCRIPTION, RANK, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_AT, CREATED_BY, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.MATCHSTATUS_ID, t.NAME, t.DESCRIPTION, t.RANK, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_AT, t.CREATED_BY, t.MODIFIED_BY, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.MATCHSTATUS t UNION SELECT a.MATCHSTATUS_ID, a.NAME, a.DESCRIPTION, a.RANK, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_AT, a.CREATED_BY, a.MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_MATCHSTATUS a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: MATCHSTATUS_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.MATCHSTATUS_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (MATCHSTATUS_ID, NAME, DESCRIPTION, RANK, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_AT, CREATED_BY, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.MATCHSTATUS_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: MODEL
table.remarks: A manipuable model,e.g. user can rotate it. It may show different views.

column.name: CREATED_BY
column.remarks: Person in Xenbase that created record

column.name: CREATED_AT
column.remarks: creation time

column.name: MODIFIED_BY
column.remarks: id of person in xenbase to last modify the record, null if never modified at

column.name: MODIFIED_AT
column.remarks: time that the record was last modified

table.name: MODEL_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.MODEL_incl_del_v (MODEL_ID, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.MODEL_ID, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.MODEL t UNION SELECT a.MODEL_ID, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_MODEL a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: MODEL_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.MODEL_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (MODEL_ID, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.MODEL_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

column.name: RANK
column.remarks: Because there are multiple mime types per extension, some are more common than others, we might want to try multiple in order of commonality.

table.name: MOVIE_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.MOVIE_incl_del_v (MOVIE_ID, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.MOVIE_ID, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.MOVIE t UNION SELECT a.MOVIE_ID, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_MOVIE a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: MOVIE_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.MOVIE_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (MOVIE_ID, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.MOVIE_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: MRNA_V
table.viewSql: create view DB2INST1.mRNA_v as select f.*, fr.object_id as gene_id from feature f, feature_relationship fr where f.type_id=738 and fr.type_id = 607 and f.feature_id=fr.subject_id

table.name: NATIVE_IMAGE
table.remarks: Images that have supplemental versions that are not in JPEG format will be stored in this table. Because images are always converted to JPEG, this will store the completely original file.

table.name: NATIVE_IMAGE_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.NATIVE_IMAGE_incl_del_v (IMAGE_ID, TYPE, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.IMAGE_ID, t.TYPE, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.NATIVE_IMAGE t UNION SELECT a.IMAGE_ID, a.TYPE, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_NATIVE_IMAGE a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: NATIVE_IMAGE_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.NATIVE_IMAGE_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (IMAGE_ID, TYPE, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.NATIVE_IMAGE_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: NLMCAT_XML
table.remarks: pubmed literature related nlmcat xml data and references

table.name: ORF_GENE_DUMP2_V
ORF_GENE_DUMP_TROP3_V
ORF_GENE_DUMP_TROP_V
table.viewSql:
create or replace view db2inst1.orf_gene_dump_trop_v as SELECT 'XB-ORF-' || f3.feature_id AS ref_orf_id, --f3.feature_id AS orf_id, f3.name AS orf_name, d.accession entrez_gene_id, mqt1.symbol gene_symbol, 'XB-GENE-' || f1.feature_id ref_gene_id, ( SELECT max('XB-GENEPAGE-' || gm2.gene_id ) FROM feature_relationship fr1, feature_relationship fr2, feature_relationship fr3, feature f, genes_mqt gm1, genes_mqt gm2 WHERE fr1.subject_id = f3.feature_id -- ORF from cDNA --> AND fr1.type_id = 607 -- derives_from --> AND f.feature_id = fr1.object_id AND f.type_id = 738 -- mRNA --> AND fr2.subject_id = f.feature_id AND fr2.type_id = 607 -- derives_from --> AND gm1.gene_id = fr2.object_id AND gm1.gene_id = fr3.subject_id AND fr3.type_id = 500 -- is_a --> AND fr3.object_id = gm2.gene_id ) umbrella_gene_id, --f1.feature_id gene_id, --f2.feature_id f2Feat,
-- ( SELECT f.name FROM feature f, feature_relationship fr WHERE f.type_id = 31695 -- five_prime_EST --> AND f.feature_id = fr.subject_id AND fr.type_id = 76 -- expressed_tag_of_gene --> AND fr.object_id = f3.feature_id -- ORF from cDNA --> ) as five_prime_EST_accession , ( SELECT f.name FROM feature f, feature_relationship fr WHERE f.type_id = 31696 -- three_prime_EST --> AND f.feature_id = fr.subject_id AND fr.type_id = 76 -- expressed_tag_of_gene --> AND fr.object_id = f3.feature_id -- ORF from cDNA -->
)as three_prime_EST_accession --,mqt1.full_name , ( SELECT --f.feature_id AS orfId, --f.name AS orfName, f.residues FROM feature f WHERE f.feature_id = f3.feature_id )as orf_Sequence, (SELECT f.residues FROM feature f, feature_relationship fr WHERE f.type_id = 5072 -- translation --> AND f.feature_id = fr.subject_id AND fr.type_id = 607 -- derives_from --> AND fr.object_id = f3.feature_id -- ORF from cDNA --> ) as orf_translation
-- FROM feature f1, feature f2, feature f3, feature_relationship fr1, feature_relationship fr2, feature_dbxref fd, dbxref d, genes_mqt mqt1 WHERE 1=1 -- d.accession LIKE #{orfSearchValue[0],jdbcType=VARCHAR} AND d.db_id = 46 -- Entrez Gene --> AND d.dbxref_id = fd.dbxref_id AND fd.feature_id = f1.feature_id AND f1.type_id = 1214 -- gene --> AND f1.feature_id = fr1.object_id AND fr1.type_id = 607 -- derives_from --> AND fr1.subject_id = f2.feature_id AND f2.type_id = 738 -- mRNA --> AND f2.feature_id = fr2.object_id AND fr2.type_id = 607 -- derives_from --> AND fr2.subject_id = f3.feature_id AND f3.type_id = 40593 -- ORF from cDNA --> --AND LOWER(VARCHAR(f3.name)) LIKE 'aagab orf1' AND mqt1.gene_id = fr1.object_id AND mqt1.organism_id IN (12)

table.name: ORF_GENE_DUMP_V
table.viewSql:
create or replace view db2inst1.orf_gene_dump_v as SELECT 'XB-ORF-' || f3.feature_id AS ref_orf_id, --f3.feature_id AS orf_id, f3.name AS orf_name, d.accession entrez_gene_id, mqt1.symbol gene_symbol, 'XB-GENE-' || f1.feature_id ref_gene_id, ( SELECT max('XB-GENEPAGE-' || gm2.gene_id ) FROM feature_relationship fr1, feature_relationship fr2, feature_relationship fr3, feature f, genes_mqt gm1, genes_mqt gm2 WHERE fr1.subject_id = f3.feature_id -- ORF from cDNA --> AND fr1.type_id = 607 -- derives_from --> AND f.feature_id = fr1.object_id AND f.type_id = 738 -- mRNA --> AND fr2.subject_id = f.feature_id AND fr2.type_id = 607 -- derives_from --> AND gm1.gene_id = fr2.object_id AND gm1.gene_id = fr3.subject_id AND fr3.type_id = 500 -- is_a --> AND fr3.object_id = gm2.gene_id ) umbrella_gene_id, --f1.feature_id gene_id, --f2.feature_id f2Feat,
-- ( SELECT f.name FROM feature f, feature_relationship fr WHERE f.type_id = 31695 -- five_prime_EST --> AND f.feature_id = fr.subject_id AND fr.type_id = 76 -- expressed_tag_of_gene --> AND fr.object_id = f3.feature_id -- ORF from cDNA --> ) as five_prime_EST_accession , ( SELECT f.name FROM feature f, feature_relationship fr WHERE f.type_id = 31696 -- three_prime_EST --> AND f.feature_id = fr.subject_id AND fr.type_id = 76 -- expressed_tag_of_gene --> AND fr.object_id = f3.feature_id -- ORF from cDNA -->
)as three_prime_EST_accession --,mqt1.full_name , ( SELECT --f.feature_id AS orfId, --f.name AS orfName, f.residues FROM feature f WHERE f.feature_id = f3.feature_id )as orf_Sequence, (SELECT f.residues FROM feature f, feature_relationship fr WHERE f.type_id = 5072 -- translation --> AND f.feature_id = fr.subject_id AND fr.type_id = 607 -- derives_from --> AND fr.object_id = f3.feature_id -- ORF from cDNA --> ) as orf_translation
-- FROM feature f1, feature f2, feature f3, feature_relationship fr1, feature_relationship fr2, feature_dbxref fd, dbxref d, genes_mqt mqt1 WHERE 1=1 -- d.accession LIKE #{orfSearchValue[0],jdbcType=VARCHAR} AND d.db_id = 46 -- Entrez Gene --> AND d.dbxref_id = fd.dbxref_id AND fd.feature_id = f1.feature_id AND f1.type_id = 1214 -- gene --> AND f1.feature_id = fr1.object_id AND fr1.type_id = 607 -- derives_from --> AND fr1.subject_id = f2.feature_id AND f2.type_id = 738 -- mRNA --> AND f2.feature_id = fr2.object_id AND fr2.type_id = 607 -- derives_from --> AND fr2.subject_id = f3.feature_id AND f3.type_id = 40593 -- ORF from cDNA --> --AND LOWER(VARCHAR(f3.name)) LIKE 'aagab orf1' AND mqt1.gene_id = fr1.object_id AND mqt1.organism_id IN (13)

column.name: SPECIES
column.remarks: A type of organism is always uniquely identified by genus+species. When mapping from the NCBI taxonomy names.dmp file, the unique-name column must be used where it is present, as the name column is not always unique (eg environmental samples)

table.name: ORGANISM_DBXREF_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.ORGANISM_DBXREF_incl_del_v (ORGANISM_DBXREF_ID, ORGANISM_ID, DBXREF_ID, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_AT, CREATED_BY, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.ORGANISM_DBXREF_ID, t.ORGANISM_ID, t.DBXREF_ID, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_AT, t.CREATED_BY, t.MODIFIED_BY, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.ORGANISM_DBXREF t UNION SELECT a.ORGANISM_DBXREF_ID, a.ORGANISM_ID, a.DBXREF_ID, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_AT, a.CREATED_BY, a.MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_ORGANISM_DBXREF a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: ORGANISM_DBXREF_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.ORGANISM_DBXREF_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (ORGANISM_DBXREF_ID, ORGANISM_ID, DBXREF_ID, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_AT, CREATED_BY, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.ORGANISM_DBXREF_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: ORGANISMPROP_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.ORGANISMPROP_incl_del_v (ORGANISMPROP_ID, ORGANISM_ID, TYPE_ID, VALUE, RANK, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_AT, CREATED_BY, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.ORGANISMPROP_ID, t.ORGANISM_ID, t.TYPE_ID, t.VALUE, t.RANK, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_AT, t.CREATED_BY, t.MODIFIED_BY, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.ORGANISMPROP t UNION SELECT a.ORGANISMPROP_ID, a.ORGANISM_ID, a.TYPE_ID, a.VALUE, a.RANK, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_AT, a.CREATED_BY, a.MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_ORGANISMPROP a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: ORGANISMPROP_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.ORGANISMPROP_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (ORGANISMPROP_ID, ORGANISM_ID, TYPE_ID, VALUE, RANK, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_AT, CREATED_BY, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.ORGANISMPROP_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: ORGANIZATION
table.remarks: Any organization involved in Xenopus research, including companies universities, institutes.

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.remarks: description of services or activities perfromed by the organization that relate to Xenopus research.

column.name: URL
column.remarks: organization web site

column.name: APPROVED
column.remarks: Organization has been approved. An organization may be entered by anyone but must be manually approved by a user

column.name: ORGANIZATIONTYPE_ID
column.remarks: Type of Organization, e.g. University, business

table.name: ORGANIZATION_ABBREV
table.remarks: This table holds abbreviations or acronyms for organizations that may be used commonly, by spefic institutions and/or as codes in data files.

table.name: ORGANIZATION_ABBREV_TYPE
table.remarks: This describes different types of organization abbreviation. i.e. NIH 2 letter codes

table.name: ORGANIZATION_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.ORGANIZATION_incl_del_v (ORGANIZATION_ID, NAME, URL, APPROVED, CREATED_AT, CREATED_BY, ORGANIZATIONTYPE_ID, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.ORGANIZATION_ID, t.NAME, t.URL, t.APPROVED, t.CREATED_AT, t.CREATED_BY, t.ORGANIZATIONTYPE_ID, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.ORGANIZATION t UNION SELECT a.ORGANIZATION_ID, a.NAME, a.URL, a.APPROVED, a.CREATED_AT, a.CREATED_BY, a.ORGANIZATIONTYPE_ID, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_ORGANIZATION a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: ORGANIZATION_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.ORGANIZATION_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (ORGANIZATION_ID, NAME, URL, APPROVED, CREATED_AT, CREATED_BY, ORGANIZATIONTYPE_ID, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.ORGANIZATION_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: ORGANIZATIONEMAIL
table.remarks: email addresses associated with organizations with some additions.

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.remarks: description of what the URL is

column.name: EMAIL
column.remarks: email address for the organizaiton

table.name: ORGANIZATIONEMAIL_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.ORGANIZATIONEMAIL_incl_del_v (ORGANIZATIONEMAIL_ID, DESCRIPTION, EMAIL, ORGANIZATION_ID, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_AT, CREATED_BY, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.ORGANIZATIONEMAIL_ID, t.DESCRIPTION, t.EMAIL, t.ORGANIZATION_ID, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_AT, t.CREATED_BY, t.MODIFIED_BY, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.ORGANIZATIONEMAIL t UNION SELECT a.ORGANIZATIONEMAIL_ID, a.DESCRIPTION, a.EMAIL, a.ORGANIZATION_ID, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_AT, a.CREATED_BY, a.MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_ORGANIZATIONEMAIL a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: ORGANIZATIONEMAIL_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.ORGANIZATIONEMAIL_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (ORGANIZATIONEMAIL_ID, DESCRIPTION, EMAIL, ORGANIZATION_ID, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_AT, CREATED_BY, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.ORGANIZATIONEMAIL_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: ORGANIZATIONTYPE
table.remarks: Validation table: type of organization such as company, university.

table.name: ORPHANED_DBXREFS
table.remarks: This tables is used in the process of using the of deleting dbxrefs that are dependent on a cvterm that is being deleted

table.name: PAPER
table.remarks: A Scholarly work, published work

column.name: PAPER_ID
column.remarks: Xenbase accession number for paper

column.name: TITLE
column.remarks: Full title of paper

column.name: ABSTRACT
column.remarks: article abstract

column.name: ABSTRACT_MARKUP
column.remarks: article abstract marked up with links to Genes, etc.

column.name: PAGINATION
column.remarks: pages of paper in it's containing source

column.name: JOURNALISSUE_ID
column.remarks: Journal issue with paper, if the paper is a journal paper

column.name: BOOK_ID
column.remarks: book id if the paper is a chapter in a book

column.name: AUTHOR_LIST_COMPLETE
column.remarks: If not complete, s/b translated into et al. for citation listing.

column.name: CREATED_BY
column.remarks: Application user that created the record

column.name: CREATED_AT
column.remarks: timestamp when the record was created

column.name: MODIFIED_AT
column.remarks: timestamp when the record was last modified. Null if never modified.

column.name: MODIFIED_BY
column.remarks: Application user that last changed the record

column.name: TITLE_MARKUP
column.remarks: Stores XML version of title with link matching information

table.name: PAPER_AUTHOR
table.remarks: These records store authors of papers and their matches to organization and person records. It also indicates which when something that was thought to be a match has been manually determined not to be a match.

column.name: PAPERAUTHOR_ID
column.remarks: Xenbase Id for this table

column.name: RANK
column.remarks: order in the author list for the parent paper

column.name: FORENAME
column.remarks: Author first name. Corresponds to the medline author XML element.

column.name: INITIALS
column.remarks: First name and any other name initials- Corresponds to the medline author XML element.

column.name: LASTNAME
column.remarks: Author's last name- corresponds to the medline author XML element.

column.name: SUFFIX
column.remarks: Suffix such as 1st, 2nd, Third- Corresponds to the medline author XML element.

column.name: IS_NAME_VALID
column.remarks: Indicates if the pubmed database considers this name valid.

column.name: IS_NOT
column.remarks: This indicates that this record is not a match with the specified author or organization despite of other evidence to the contrary. This should only be set to true in the article was manually unassigned from a person by the person or an adminstrator.

column.name: COLLECTIVE_NAME
column.remarks: name of an organizational author- corresponds to the medline author XML element.

table.name: PAPER_AUTHOR_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW "DB2INST1"."PAPER_AUTHOR_INCL_DEL_V" ("PAPERAUTHOR_ID", "RANK", "FORENAME", "INITIALS", "LASTNAME", "SUFFIX", "IS_NAME_VALID", "IS_NOT", "COLLECTIVE_NAME", "PAPER_ID", "ORGANIZATION_ID", "CREATED_BY", "CREATED_AT", "MODIFIED_AT", "MODIFIED_BY", "CITATION_NAME", "TRANSACTION_DATE", "TRANSACTION_TYPE") AS SELECT t.PAPERAUTHOR_ID, t.RANK, t.FORENAME, t.INITIALS, t.LASTNAME, t.SUFFIX, t.IS_NAME_VALID, t.IS_NOT, t.COLLECTIVE_NAME, t.PAPER_ID, t.ORGANIZATION_ID, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.CITATION_NAME, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.PAPER_AUTHOR t UNION SELECT a.PAPERAUTHOR_ID, a.RANK, a.FORENAME, a.INITIALS, a.LASTNAME, a.SUFFIX, a.IS_NAME_VALID, a.IS_NOT, a.COLLECTIVE_NAME, a.PAPER_ID, a.ORGANIZATION_ID, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.CITATION_NAME,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_PAPER_AUTHOR a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: PAPER_AUTHOR_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW "DB2INST1"."PAPER_AUTHOR_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V" ("PAPERAUTHOR_ID", "RANK", "FORENAME", "INITIALS", "LASTNAME", "SUFFIX", "IS_NAME_VALID", "IS_NOT", "COLLECTIVE_NAME", "PAPER_ID", "ORGANIZATION_ID", "CREATED_BY", "CREATED_AT", "MODIFIED_AT", "MODIFIED_BY", "CITATION_NAME", "TRANSACTION_DATE", "TRANSACTION_TYPE") AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.PAPER_AUTHOR_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: PAPER_CITATION
table.remarks: List of referenced and cited_by for each paper.

column.name: OBJECT_PAPER_ID
column.remarks: xenbase paper as the source of citations

column.name: SUBJECT_PUBMED_ID
column.remarks: redundant pubmed id per the paper_cited paper

column.name: XB_ART_PAPER_ID
column.remarks: with a xenbase paper the XB-ART-paper_id for the link

column.name: SUBJECT_TITLE
column.remarks: title of paper

column.name: SUBJECT_AUTHOR
column.remarks: pubmed paper author listing, need only the first author

column.name: SUBJECT_PUB_YEAR
column.remarks: pubmed paper, year published

column.name: TYPE_ID
column.remarks: pubmed paper, cited by or has reference to xenbase paper

table.name: PAPER_DBXREF
table.remarks: Used to link to papers to external references, such as electronic copies on publisher sites)

table.name: PAPER_DBXREF_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.PAPER_DBXREF_incl_del_v (PAPER_ID, DBXREF_ID, PAPERDBXREFTYPE_ID, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_AT, CREATED_BY, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.PAPER_ID, t.DBXREF_ID, t.PAPERDBXREFTYPE_ID, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_AT, t.CREATED_BY, t.MODIFIED_BY, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.PAPER_DBXREF t UNION SELECT a.PAPER_ID, a.DBXREF_ID, a.PAPERDBXREFTYPE_ID, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_AT, a.CREATED_BY, a.MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_PAPER_DBXREF a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: PAPER_DBXREF_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.PAPER_DBXREF_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (PAPER_ID, DBXREF_ID, PAPERDBXREFTYPE_ID, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_AT, CREATED_BY, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.PAPER_DBXREF_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: PAPER_EXPERIMENT_V
table.viewSql: create or replace view db2inst1.paper_experiment_v as select a1.source_row_id paper_id, a1.object_row_id experiment_id from attribution a1 where 1=1 and a1.OBJECT_NAME = 'EXPERIMENT' and a1.SOURCE_NAME = 'PAPER'

table.name: PAPER_IMAGE_GENES_MQT
table.remarks: This is an artificial MQT for paper image to gene features

table.name: PAPER_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.PAPER_incl_del_v (PAPER_ID, TITLE, PAGINATION, PAPERTYPE_ID, JOURNALISSUE_ID, BOOK_ID, AUTHOR_LIST_COMPLETE, PUBMED_ID, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, TITLE_MARKUP,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.PAPER_ID, t.TITLE, t.PAGINATION, t.PAPERTYPE_ID, t.JOURNALISSUE_ID, t.BOOK_ID, t.AUTHOR_LIST_COMPLETE, t.PUBMED_ID, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.TITLE_MARKUP, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.PAPER t UNION SELECT a.PAPER_ID, a.TITLE, a.PAGINATION, a.PAPERTYPE_ID, a.JOURNALISSUE_ID, a.BOOK_ID, a.AUTHOR_LIST_COMPLETE, a.PUBMED_ID, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.TITLE_MARKUP,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_PAPER a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: PAPER_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.PAPER_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (PAPER_ID, TITLE, PAGINATION, PAPERTYPE_ID, JOURNALISSUE_ID, BOOK_ID, AUTHOR_LIST_COMPLETE, PUBMED_ID, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, TITLE_MARKUP,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.PAPER_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: PAPERDBXREFTYPE
table.remarks: Decribes the type dbxref referenced by the paper

table.name: PAPERTYPE
table.remarks: Validation for type of paper such as journa article or chapter

column.name: PAPERTYPE_ID
column.remarks: id of paper type

column.name: NAME
column.remarks: name of paper type

table.name: PERSON
table.remarks: This table contains persons in the Xenopus community.

column.name: PERSON_ID
column.remarks: Identifier for the table

column.name: USER_NAME
column.remarks: user choosen log in name

column.name: PASS_WORD
column.remarks: user choosen password

column.name: LOST_PW_QUESTION
column.remarks: Field stores user-entered question to be answered by user if they need to recover their password

column.name: LOST_PW_ANSWER
column.remarks: Field stores the answer to the user entered question for password recovery

column.name: LAST_LOGIN
column.remarks: TIMESTAMP of last login

column.name: PREFIX
column.remarks: Honourary prefix such as Dr.

column.name: SUFFIX
column.remarks: suffix for name such as Jr.

column.name: ADMINISTRATOR
column.remarks: user has system-wide adminstration privileges.

column.name: ENABLED
column.remarks: user account is currently enabled

column.name: IS_CURRENT
column.remarks: user is a current user. non-current users are kept for maintenance of created_by and modified_by records.

column.name: TITLE
column.remarks: Person's last known job title

column.name: EMAIL
column.remarks: email address

column.name: URL
column.remarks: home page url

column.name: PICTURE_ID
column.remarks: id of person's picture

column.name: INFORMATION
column.remarks: information about the person and their relationship to the Xenopus community.

column.name: APPROVED
column.remarks: indicator that the person has been approved. Person's are automatically created on registration.

column.name: IS_PUBLIC
column.remarks: Will this user's personal information be displayed publicly

column.name: BUILT_IN
column.remarks: This is a system built in user. If set to 1 (true) only built_in and user pass_word can be update, there should never be a user interface to this field.)

column.name: ADDRESS_ID
column.remarks: mailing address for the person

checkConstraint.constraint: (USER_NAME IS NULL AND PASS_WORD IS NULL) OR (USER_NAME IS NOT NULL AND PASS_WORD IS NOT NULL)
checkConstraint.name: UNAME_PWORD_CHK

table.name: PERSON_AUTHOR
table.remarks: This contains matches and rejected matches between authors drawn from pubmed loads

column.name: CONFIRMATION_STATUS
column.remarks: Starts as null, C indicates author has confirmed the match, R indicates that they have rejected the macth

column.name: MATCHSTATUS_ID
column.remarks: attaches the match to a match level based on the method used to make the match

table.name: PERSON_AUTHOR_HISTORY
table.remarks: This table stores changes to the person_author table, In particular this records are created in this table when match_status or confirmation_statu is changed in the confirmation table

column.name: MODIFIED_AT
column.remarks: This is the time when person_author table was created or modified to contain the vaules in this history record

column.name: MODIFIED_BY
column.remarks: The person who created or modified person_author to contain the values in this history record

table.name: PERSON_AUTHOR_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.PERSON_AUTHOR_incl_del_v (PERSONAUTHOR_ID, PERSON_ID, PAPERAUTHOR_ID, PERSONAUTHORMATCH_ID, CONFIRMATION_STATUS, MATCHSTATUS_ID, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_AT, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.PERSONAUTHOR_ID, t.PERSON_ID, t.PAPERAUTHOR_ID, t.PERSONAUTHORMATCH_ID, t.CONFIRMATION_STATUS, t.MATCHSTATUS_ID, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.PERSON_AUTHOR t UNION SELECT a.PERSONAUTHOR_ID, a.PERSON_ID, a.PAPERAUTHOR_ID, a.PERSONAUTHORMATCH_ID, a.CONFIRMATION_STATUS, a.MATCHSTATUS_ID, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_PERSON_AUTHOR a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: PERSON_AUTHOR_MATCH
table.remarks: stores identifiers for different batch matches that are run. It is useful for then generating bulk mailings for matches that have been run

column.name: IS_EMAILED
column.remarks: indicates whether matched people have been sent email yet asking them to confirm matches

table.name: person_author_match_1_v
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW "DB2INST1"."person_author_match_1_v" ("PAPERAUTHOR_ID", "PERSON_ID", "PERSON_MODIFIED_AT", "AUTHOR_MODIFIED_AT") AS SELECT pa.paperauthor_id, p.person_id, p.modified_at person_modified_at, pa.modified_at author_modified_at FROM paper_author pa, person p WHERE LOWER(VARCHAR(pa.lastname)) = LOWER(VARCHAR(p.last_name)) AND LOWER(LEFT(pa.initials, 1)) = LOWER(LEFT(VARCHAR(p.first_name), 1)) AND p.middle_name IS NULL AND pa.organization_id IS NULL

table.name: PERSON_AUTHOR_MATCH_2_V
table.remarks: Corresponds to ""MATCH 2"" in table matchstatus. View for use in author person matching algorithm. Last names, first and middle initials match.
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW "DB2INST1"."PERSON_AUTHOR_MATCH_2_V" ("PAPERAUTHOR_ID", "PERSON_ID", "PERSON_MODIFIED_AT", "AUTHOR_MODIFIED_AT") AS SELECT pa.paperauthor_id, p.person_id, p.modified_at person_modified_at, pa.modified_at author_modified_at FROM paper_author pa, person p WHERE LOWER(VARCHAR(pa.lastname)) = LOWER(VARCHAR(p.last_name)) AND LOWER(pa.initials) = LOWER(VARCHAR(LEFT(VARCHAR(p.first_name), 1) || LEFT(VARCHAR(p.middle_name), 1))) AND pa.organization_id IS NULL

table.name: PERSON_AUTHOR_MATCH_3_V
table.remarks: Corresponds to ""MATCH 3"" in table matchstatus. View for use in author person matching algorithm. First and last names match
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW "DB2INST1"."PERSON_AUTHOR_MATCH_3_V" ("PAPERAUTHOR_ID", "PERSON_ID", "PERSON_MODIFIED_AT", "AUTHOR_MODIFIED_AT") AS SELECT pa.paperauthor_id, p.person_id, p.modified_at person_modified_at, pa.modified_at author_modified_at FROM paper_author pa, person p WHERE LOWER(VARCHAR(pa.lastname)) = LOWER(VARCHAR(p.last_name)) AND LOWER(VARCHAR(pa.forename)) = LOWER(VARCHAR(p.first_name)) AND pa.organization_id IS NULL

table.name: PERSON_AUTHOR_MATCH_4_V
table.remarks: Corresponds to ""MATCH 4"" in table matchstatus. Last name and First Name concatenated with space and middle initial match (this is how forename from pubmed is usually expressed ,e.g, ""Peter D""
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW "DB2INST1"."PERSON_AUTHOR_MATCH_4_V" ("PAPERAUTHOR_ID", "PERSON_ID", "PERSON_MODIFIED_AT", "AUTHOR_MODIFIED_AT") AS SELECT pa.paperauthor_id, p.person_id, p.modified_at person_modified_at, pa.modified_at author_modified_at FROM paper_author pa, person p WHERE LOWER(VARCHAR(pa.lastName)) = LOWER(VARCHAR(p.last_name)) AND LOWER(VARCHAR(pa.foreName)) = LOWER(VARCHAR(VARCHAR(p.first_name) || ' ' || LEFT(VARCHAR(p.middle_name),1))) AND pa.organization_id IS NULL

table.name: PERSON_AUTHOR_MATCH_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.PERSON_AUTHOR_MATCH_incl_del_v (PERSONAUTHORMATCH_ID, IS_EMAILED, MATCH_TS, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_AT, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.PERSONAUTHORMATCH_ID, t.IS_EMAILED, t.MATCH_TS, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.PERSON_AUTHOR_MATCH t UNION SELECT a.PERSONAUTHORMATCH_ID, a.IS_EMAILED, a.MATCH_TS, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_PERSON_AUTHOR_MATCH a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: PERSON_AUTHOR_MATCH_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.PERSON_AUTHOR_MATCH_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (PERSONAUTHORMATCH_ID, IS_EMAILED, MATCH_TS, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_AT, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.PERSON_AUTHOR_MATCH_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: PERSON_AUTHOR_MATCH_V
table.remarks: Simple Join of person_author and matchstatus
table.viewSql: CREATE view person_author_match_v AS (SELECT pap.*, ms.rank FROM person_author pap, matchstatus ms WHERE pap.matchstatus_id = ms.matchstatus_id)

table.name: PERSON_AUTHOR_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.PERSON_AUTHOR_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (PERSONAUTHOR_ID, PERSON_ID, PAPERAUTHOR_ID, PERSONAUTHORMATCH_ID, CONFIRMATION_STATUS, MATCHSTATUS_ID, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_AT, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.PERSON_AUTHOR_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: PERSON_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.PERSON_incl_del_v (PERSON_ID, USER_NAME, PASS_WORD, LOST_PW_QUESTION, LOST_PW_ANSWER, FIRST_NAME, MIDDLE_NAME, LAST_NAME, LAST_LOGIN, PREFIX, SUFFIX, ADMINISTRATOR, ENABLED, IS_CURRENT, TITLE, EMAIL, URL, PICTURE_ID, APPROVED, IS_PUBLIC, BUILT_IN, ADDRESS_ID, CREATED_AT, CREATED_BY, MODIFIED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, FULL_NAME, REV_FULL_NAME,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.PERSON_ID, t.USER_NAME, t.PASS_WORD, t.LOST_PW_QUESTION, t.LOST_PW_ANSWER, t.FIRST_NAME, t.MIDDLE_NAME, t.LAST_NAME, t.LAST_LOGIN, t.PREFIX, t.SUFFIX, t.ADMINISTRATOR, t.ENABLED, t.IS_CURRENT, t.TITLE, t.EMAIL, t.URL, t.PICTURE_ID, t.APPROVED, t.IS_PUBLIC, t.BUILT_IN, t.ADDRESS_ID, t.CREATED_AT, t.CREATED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.FULL_NAME, t.REV_FULL_NAME, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.PERSON t UNION SELECT a.PERSON_ID, a.USER_NAME, a.PASS_WORD, a.LOST_PW_QUESTION, a.LOST_PW_ANSWER, a.FIRST_NAME, a.MIDDLE_NAME, a.LAST_NAME, a.LAST_LOGIN, a.PREFIX, a.SUFFIX, a.ADMINISTRATOR, a.ENABLED, a.IS_CURRENT, a.TITLE, a.EMAIL, a.URL, a.PICTURE_ID, a.APPROVED, a.IS_PUBLIC, a.BUILT_IN, a.ADDRESS_ID, a.CREATED_AT, a.CREATED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.FULL_NAME, a.REV_FULL_NAME,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_PERSON a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: PERSON_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.PERSON_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (PERSON_ID, USER_NAME, PASS_WORD, LOST_PW_QUESTION, LOST_PW_ANSWER, FIRST_NAME, MIDDLE_NAME, LAST_NAME, LAST_LOGIN, PREFIX, SUFFIX, ADMINISTRATOR, ENABLED, IS_CURRENT, TITLE, EMAIL, URL, PICTURE_ID, APPROVED, IS_PUBLIC, BUILT_IN, ADDRESS_ID, CREATED_AT, CREATED_BY, MODIFIED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, FULL_NAME, REV_FULL_NAME,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.PERSON_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: PERSONLAB
table.remarks: Relationship that a person has to a lab. A person my be associated with more than one lab.

column.name: PERSON_ID
column.remarks: Person associated with the lab

column.name: LAB_ID
column.remarks: lab that the person is associated with

column.name: PERSONLABROLE_ID
column.remarks: Person's role with the lab

column.name: ADMINISTERS
column.remarks: The person in this relationship will have administrative privileges over the lab.

column.name: IS_CONTACT_FOR
column.remarks: This person will act as a contact for this lab in it's dealings with Xenbase

column.name: APPROVED
column.remarks: a person has been approved for lab membership

table.name: PERSONLAB_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.PERSONLAB_incl_del_v (PERSON_ID, LAB_ID, PERSONLABROLE_ID, ADMINISTERS, IS_CONTACT_FOR, APPROVED, CREATED_AT, CREATED_BY, MODIFIED_AT, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.PERSON_ID, t.LAB_ID, t.PERSONLABROLE_ID, t.ADMINISTERS, t.IS_CONTACT_FOR, t.APPROVED, t.CREATED_AT, t.CREATED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.PERSONLAB t UNION SELECT a.PERSON_ID, a.LAB_ID, a.PERSONLABROLE_ID, a.ADMINISTERS, a.IS_CONTACT_FOR, a.APPROVED, a.CREATED_AT, a.CREATED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_PERSONLAB a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: PERSONLAB_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.PERSONLAB_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (PERSON_ID, LAB_ID, PERSONLABROLE_ID, ADMINISTERS, IS_CONTACT_FOR, APPROVED, CREATED_AT, CREATED_BY, MODIFIED_AT, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.PERSONLAB_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: PERSONORGANIZATION_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.PERSONORGANIZATION_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (ADMINISTERS, PERSON_ID, ORGANIZATION_ID, PERSORGROLETYPE_ID, IS_CONTACT_FOR, CREATED_AT, CREATED_BY, MODIFIED_AT, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.PERSONORGANIZATION_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: PERSONPHONE
table.remarks: phone associated with a person (This could be a fax, pager or some other device.

column.name: PERSON_ID
column.remarks: Identifier for the table

table.name: PERSONPHONE_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.PERSONPHONE_incl_del_v (PERSON_ID, PHONE_ID, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_AT, CREATED_BY, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.PERSON_ID, t.PHONE_ID, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_AT, t.CREATED_BY, t.MODIFIED_BY, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.PERSONPHONE t UNION SELECT a.PERSON_ID, a.PHONE_ID, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_AT, a.CREATED_BY, a.MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_PERSONPHONE a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.PERSONPHONE_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (PERSON_ID, PHONE_ID, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_AT, CREATED_BY, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.PERSONPHONE_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.remarks: description of phone. This is only used by organizations.

column.name: PHONE_NUMBER
column.remarks: phone number including area code

column.name: EXTENSION
column.remarks: phone extension

checkConstraint.constraint: ORGANIZATION_ID IS NULL OR LAB_ID IS NULL
checkConstraint.name: PH_LAB_XOR_ORG_CHK

table.name: PHONE_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.PHONE_incl_del_v (PHONE_ID, DESCRIPTION, PHONE_NUMBER, EXTENSION, ORGANIZATION_ID, LAB_ID, PHONETYPE_ID, CREATED_AT, CREATED_BY, MODIFIED_AT, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.PHONE_ID, t.DESCRIPTION, t.PHONE_NUMBER, t.EXTENSION, t.ORGANIZATION_ID, t.LAB_ID, t.PHONETYPE_ID, t.CREATED_AT, t.CREATED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.PHONE t UNION SELECT a.PHONE_ID, a.DESCRIPTION, a.PHONE_NUMBER, a.EXTENSION, a.ORGANIZATION_ID, a.LAB_ID, a.PHONETYPE_ID, a.CREATED_AT, a.CREATED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_PHONE a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: PHONE_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.PHONE_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (PHONE_ID, DESCRIPTION, PHONE_NUMBER, EXTENSION, ORGANIZATION_ID, LAB_ID, PHONETYPE_ID, CREATED_AT, CREATED_BY, MODIFIED_AT, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.PHONE_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: PHONETYPE
table.remarks: validation table: type of phone, home, fax, etc.

table.name: PHYLONODE
table.remarks: Nodes in the phylogeny tree.

column.name: TYPE_ID
column.remarks: Type: e.g. root, interior, leaf. In our case for taxonomy it will store taxonomy level

column.name: FEATURE_ID
column.remarks: optional features attached to them e.g. a protein or nucleotide sequence usually attached to a leaf for non-leaf nodes, the feature may be a feature that is an instance of SO:match; this feature is the alignment of all leaf features beneath it.

table.name: PHYLONODE_ANATOMYITEM
table.remarks: Identify each species for which the anatomy_item is seen.

table.name: PHYLONODE_DBXREF
table.remarks: For example, for orthology, paralogy group identifiers; could also be used for NCBI taxonomy; for sequences, refer to phylonode_feature, feature associated dbxrefs.

table.name: PHYLONODE_DBXREF_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.PHYLONODE_DBXREF_incl_del_v (PHYLONODE_DBXREF_ID, PHYLONODE_ID, DBXREF_ID, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.PHYLONODE_DBXREF_ID, t.PHYLONODE_ID, t.DBXREF_ID, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.PHYLONODE_DBXREF t UNION SELECT a.PHYLONODE_DBXREF_ID, a.PHYLONODE_ID, a.DBXREF_ID, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_PHYLONODE_DBXREF a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: PHYLONODE_DBXREF_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.PHYLONODE_DBXREF_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (PHYLONODE_DBXREF_ID, PHYLONODE_ID, DBXREF_ID, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.PHYLONODE_DBXREF_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: PHYLONODE_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.PHYLONODE_incl_del_v (PHYLONODE_ID, PHYLOTREE_ID, TYPE_ID, FEATURE_ID, LABEL, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.PHYLONODE_ID, t.PHYLOTREE_ID, t.TYPE_ID, t.FEATURE_ID, t.LABEL, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.PHYLONODE t UNION SELECT a.PHYLONODE_ID, a.PHYLOTREE_ID, a.TYPE_ID, a.FEATURE_ID, a.LABEL, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_PHYLONODE a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: PHYLONODE_ORGANISM
table.remarks: Taxonomy property.

column.name: ORGANISM_ID
column.remarks: organism id

table.name: PHYLONODE_RELATIONSHIP
table.remarks: This is for relationships that are not strictly hierarchical; for example, horizontal gene transfer. Most phylogenetic trees are strictly hierarchical, nevertheless it is here for completeness.

table.name: PHYLONODE_RELATIONSHIP_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.PHYLONODE_RELATIONSHIP_incl_del_v (PHYLONODE_RELATIONSHIP_ID, SUBJECT_ID, OBJECT_ID, TYPE_ID, PHYLOTREE_ID, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.PHYLONODE_RELATIONSHIP_ID, t.SUBJECT_ID, t.OBJECT_ID, t.TYPE_ID, t.PHYLOTREE_ID, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.PHYLONODE_RELATIONSHIP t UNION SELECT a.PHYLONODE_RELATIONSHIP_ID, a.SUBJECT_ID, a.OBJECT_ID, a.TYPE_ID, a.PHYLOTREE_ID, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_PHYLONODE_RELATIONSHIP a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: PHYLONODE_RELATIONSHIP_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.PHYLONODE_RELATIONSHIP_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (PHYLONODE_RELATIONSHIP_ID, SUBJECT_ID, OBJECT_ID, TYPE_ID, PHYLOTREE_ID, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.PHYLONODE_RELATIONSHIP_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: PHYLONODE_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.PHYLONODE_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (PHYLONODE_ID, PHYLOTREE_ID, TYPE_ID, FEATURE_ID, LABEL, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.PHYLONODE_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: PHYLONODE_STAGES
table.remarks: Identify each species for which the stage is seen in

table.name: PHYLOTREE
table.remarks: Global anchor for phylogenetic tree.

column.name: TYPE_ID
column.remarks: Type: protein, nucleotide, taxonomy, for example. The type should be any SO type, or """"taxonomy".

table.name: PHYLOTREE_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.PHYLOTREE_incl_del_v (PHYLOTREE_ID, DBXREF_ID, NAME, TYPE_ID, ANALYSIS_ID, COMMENT, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.PHYLOTREE_ID, t.DBXREF_ID, t.NAME, t.TYPE_ID, t.ANALYSIS_ID, t.COMMENT, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, t.MODIFIED_AT, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.PHYLOTREE t UNION SELECT a.PHYLOTREE_ID, a.DBXREF_ID, a.NAME, a.TYPE_ID, a.ANALYSIS_ID, a.COMMENT, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY, a.MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_PHYLOTREE a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: PHYLOTREE_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.PHYLOTREE_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (PHYLOTREE_ID, DBXREF_ID, NAME, TYPE_ID, ANALYSIS_ID, COMMENT, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_BY, MODIFIED_AT,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.PHYLOTREE_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: PMC_IMAGE_INVENTORY_REF
table.remarks: pmc image loader inventory data from pmc.csv

table.name: POLYPEPTIDE_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW db2inst1.polypeptide_V AS SELECT f.*, fr.object_id AS mRNA_id FROM feature f, feature_relationship fr WHERE f.type_id = 606 AND fr.type_id = 607 AND f.feature_id = fr.subject_id

column.name: PREFIX
column.remarks: Mr, Dr. etc

table.name: PROBE_CDNAS_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW probe_cdnas_v AS ( select p.probe_id, f.feature_id as cdna_id, f.name as cdna_name from expression_probe_v p, feature_relationship fr, feature f where fr.subject_id=p.probe_id AND fr.type_id=607 AND f.feature_id=fr.object_id AND f.type_id=822 )

table.name: PROBE_GENES_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW probe_genes_v AS ( select p.probe_id, f.feature_id as gene_id, f.name as gene_symbol, f.feature_id as umbrella_gene_id, f.name as umbrella_gene_symbol from expression_probe_v p, feature_relationship fr, feature f where fr.subject_id=p.probe_id AND fr.type_id IN(607,63) AND f.feature_id=fr.object_id AND f.type_id=1214 AND f.organism_id=11 UNION select p.probe_id, f.feature_id as gene_id, f.name as gene_symbol, f2.feature_id as umbrella_gene_id, f2.name as umbrella_gene_symbol from expression_probe_v p, feature_relationship fr, feature f, feature_relationship fr2, feature f2 where fr.subject_id=p.probe_id AND fr.type_id IN(607,63) AND f.feature_id=fr.object_id AND f.type_id=1214 AND fr2.subject_id=f.feature_id AND fr2.type_id=500 AND f2.feature_id=fr2.object_id AND f2.type_id=1214 AND f2.organism_id=11 UNION select p.probe_id, f2.feature_id as gene_id, f2.name as gene_symbol, f3.feature_id as umbrella_gene_id, f3.name as umbrella_gene_symbol from expression_probe_v p, feature_relationship fr, feature f, feature_relationship fr2, feature f2, feature_relationship fr3, feature f3 where fr.subject_id=p.probe_id AND fr.type_id=607 AND f.feature_id=fr.object_id AND f.type_id=738 AND fr2.subject_id=f.feature_id AND fr2.type_id=607 AND f2.feature_id=fr2.object_id AND f2.type_id=1214 AND fr3.subject_id=f2.feature_id AND fr3.type_id=500 AND f3.feature_id=fr3.object_id AND f3.type_id=1214 AND f3.organism_id=11 )

table.name: PROBEFT_V
table.viewSql: Create View db2inst1.probeft_v AS SELECT * FROM feature WHERE type_id = 553

table.name: PUBMED_XML
table.remarks: pubmed literature xml data and references

table.name: REAGENT_SEQUENCE_ALIGNMENT
table.remarks: Associate BLAST alignment results with a feature

table.name: REALPERSON_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW REALPERSON_V AS SELECT * FROM person WHERE BUILT_IN = 0

table.name: REFUSEDPAPERS
table.remarks: This table holds articles from pubmed that should not be brought over from pubmed because they are determined not to be relevant to Xenopus

column.name: CREATED_BY
column.remarks: Application user that created the record

column.name: CREATED_AT
column.remarks: timestamp when the record was created

column.name: MODIFIED_AT
column.remarks: timestamp when the record was last modified. Null if never modified.

column.name: MODIFIED_BY
column.remarks: Application user that last changed the record

table.name: REFUSEDPAPERS_INCL_DEL_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.REFUSEDPAPERS_incl_del_v (PUBMED_ID, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_AT, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT t.PUBMED_ID, t.CREATED_BY, t.CREATED_AT, t.MODIFIED_AT, t.MODIFIED_BY, coalesce(t.modified_at, t.created_at) as transaction_time, CASE WHEN t.modified_at IS NULL THEN 'I' ELSE 'U' END AS transaction_date FROM DB2INST1.REFUSEDPAPERS t UNION SELECT a.PUBMED_ID, a.CREATED_BY, a.CREATED_AT, a.MODIFIED_AT, a.MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type FROM DB2INST1.AUDIT_REFUSEDPAPERS a WHERE transaction_type = 'D'

table.name: REFUSEDPAPERS_SINCE_LAST_SRCHINDX_GEN_V
table.viewSql: CREATE VIEW DB2INST1.REFUSEDPAPERS_since_last_srchindx_gen_v (PUBMED_ID, CREATED_BY, CREATED_AT, MODIFIED_AT, MODIFIED_BY,transaction_date, transaction_type) AS SELECT * FROM DB2INST1.REFUSEDPAPERS_incl_del_v WHERE transaction_date > (select time from last_search_index_v)

table.name: RESEARCH_GRANT

column.name: ORGANIZATION_ID

table.name: SC_DATA_FACT

table.name: SC_DATA_FACT_AGG

column.name: TOT_VAL_UMI

table.name: SC_ISOGROUP_DIM

table.name: SC_REFGROUP_DIM

table.name: SEARCH_TYPE

column.name: HITNUMBER

column.name: SEQLEN

column.name: ALIGNLEN
